0.title: Bad sign for healthy democracy: Cong's Pilot after being detained
0.article_body: Congress leader Sachin Pilot, after being detained for trying to enter the party office, said that his detention was a bad sign for a healthy democracy. "I don't know what next they plan to do with us. This sort of detainment has never happened before. This behaviour in a civil society is just not done," he said.

1.title: This is cute, I had no idea: PhonePe CEO on reports of company filing for IPO
1.article_body: Hours after reports came out that PhonePe is considering raising funds through an initial public offering (IPO), its Founder and CEO Sameer Nigam said he had no idea about it. "This is cute. I had no idea my own company is filing an IPO," he wrote. Reports said the company is seeking a valuation of $8-10 billion.

2.title: Supreme Court to hear plea against demolitions by UP govt tomorrow
2.article_body: Supreme Court will on Thursday hear a petition seeking directions to the Uttar Pradesh government to follow rules while carrying out demolitions in the state. The petition was filed by Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind. It sought due notice and opportunity of hearing to each of the affected persons. This comes days after authorities demolished the house of Prayagraj violence accused Javed Mohammed.

3.title: Thought dad died in Ghulam, I started howling: Deepak Tijori's daughter
3.article_body: Actor Deepak Tijori's daughter Samara Tijori spoke about the time when she thought her father died after she watched a scene featuring him in Aamir Khan-starrer 'Ghulam'. Samara said, "I was 5-6. I saw that train sequence, and that's a...well-cut sequence, you actually feel someone's hurt." "I saw...and I thought my dad died. I started crying and howling," she added.

4.title: Police use water cannons on BJP workers protesting against Kerala CM
4.article_body: Kerala Police used water cannons and tear gas to stop BJP Yuva Morcha members as they protested against CM Pinarayi Vijayan, demanding his resignation over the gold smuggling case. The BJP workers staged a protest outside the Secretariat in Thiruvananthapuram. The protests came after the prime accused in the gold smuggling case, Swapna Suresh, claimed CM's involvement in the scam.

5.title: Sharad Pawar refuses to contest for Presidential post
5.article_body:
NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Wednesday refused to contest for the upcoming Presidential election. 
"I sincerely appreciate the leaders of opposition parties for suggesting my name as a candidate for the election of the President of India, at the meeting held in Delhi. However I like to state that I have humbly declined the proposal of my candidature," Pawar said.

6.title: Mumbai sees 33% rise in daily COVID-19 cases to 2,293, highest since Jan 23
6.article_body: Mumbai reported 2,293 new COVID-19 cases on Wednesday, which is the highest since January 23 this year. This is a 33% rise in COVID-19 cases from Tuesday's 1,724 cases. The city also reported one death due to COVID-19 in the last 24 hours, while the positivity rate stood at 13.37% and the number of active cases rose to 12,341.

7.title: Production of fuel more than sufficient to take care of demand surge, clarifies govt
7.article_body: Dismissing rumours of a shortage, government clarified that production of petrol and diesel in India is more than sufficient to take care of any demand surge. "This unprecedented growth has created some temporary logistics issues at local level. Oil Companies have geared up to tackle these issues by increasing...stocks," said government. This follows reports of fuel shortages in various states.

8.title: Panvel civic body issues notice to remove illegal hoardings: Report
8.article_body: The Panvel civic body has issued a notice to remove all unauthorised banners, posters, flex boards or hoardings across the city, reports said. The civic body warned of stern action if the banners are not taken down. It has also asked political parties and citizens to take permission before putting up hoardings in public places or on building rooftops.

9.title: Appoint nodal officers to check waterlogging issues in Pune: BJP
9.article_body: BJP leaders have asked the Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) to appoint nodal officers to review the waterlogging situation in the city as part of the administration's pre-monsoon arrangements. "The civic body needs to...do traffic management to avoid chaos during the monsoon," BJP leader Sandeep Khardekar said. PMC earlier claimed that it had cleared 76 waterlogging-prone spots in the city.

10.title: Sales tax official caught while accepting ₹20 lakh bribe in Thane
10.article_body: An Assistant Commissioner of sales tax department from Thane was arrested by Anti Corruption Bureau (ACB) for accepting a bribe of ₹20 lakh from a hotelier. The accused has been identified as 42-year-old Dhananjay Janardhan Shirshat. "The complainant...told us that Dhananjay...demanded ₹30 lakh for the past assessment and for getting new GST number for his hotel," an ACB official said.

11.title: BESCOM to add 140 EV chargers in the next 6 months in Bengaluru
11.article_body: The Bangalore Electricity Supply Company (BESCOM) has said it will add 140 EV chargers in the next six months in order to strengthen the electric vehicles' charging network. BESCOM MD P Rajendra Cholan said that tenders have been invited to set up 1,000 EV charging stations across Karnataka. "Currently, BESCOM is operating 136 EV chargers in Bengaluru city," Cholan added.

12.title: Delhi sees a 23% jump in new COVID cases to 1,375; positivity rate rises to 7.01%
12.article_body: Delhi on Wednesday reported 1,375 new COVID-19 cases, a rise of 23% from 1,118 cases recorded the previous day. The city's COVID-19 positivity rate rose to 7.01% from Tuesday's 6.5%. Delhi reported zero deaths due to COVID-19 in the last 24 hours, while the active cases stood at 3,643, as per a health bulletin.

13.title: Sonu Sood helps Indian man stuck in Thailand, says 'Had to bring you back'
13.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood rescued a man stuck in Thailand. Recently, a person named Sahil Khan took to Twitter seeking the actor's help. Replying to him, Sood stated that he'll send the tickets. On June 13, Sahil tweeted, "Finally reached India...true gem @SonuSood." Sood retweeted the post and wrote, "You're my Indian brother, had to bring you back."

14.title: Gujarat woman stabs husband to death to save son from being thrashed
14.article_body: A 40-year-old woman was arrested on Tuesday for allegedly stabbing her 45-year-old husband to death in order to stop him from beating their son. The woman, a resident of Gujarat's Ahmedabad, used a kitchen knife to attack her husband on Monday night. The deceased was going to thrash his son as he wasn't able to access a few TV channels.

15.title: Which are India's 10 most valuable companies as per Hurun list?
15.article_body: Reliance Industries with a value of ₹18,87,881 crore is India's most valuable company, according to Burgundy Private Hurun India 500- Special Report. It's followed by Tata Consultancy Services, HDFC Bank, Infosys, ICICI Bank, Adani Green Energy, Bharti Airtel, Housing Development Finance Corporation, Bajaj Finance and Kotak Mahindra Bank. The total value of these companies is ₹71.8 lakh crore.

16.title: Sidharth Malhotra goes on a bike ride with Sadhguru, shares pics
16.article_body: Taking to Instagram, actor Sidharth Malhotra shared few pictures of a bike ride with Sadhguru for 'Save Soil Movement'. In one picture, Sidharth and Sadhguru could be seen sitting on bikes and posing for the camera. In the photos, Sidharth is seen wearing a white T-shirt, while Sadhguru donned a yellow t-shirt with Save Our Soil written on it.

17.title: PM Modi to visit his mother in Guj on her 100th birthday on June 18
17.article_body: PM Modi is likely to visit Gujarat on June 18 to visit his mother, who will be turning 100 that day. A celebration has also been organised at the Modi's native town of Vadnagar in the Mehsana district by Hiraba's (PM's mother) sons in the evening. "Hiraba's presence at the event will depend on her health," said Prahlad Modi.

18.title: Bihar woman constable thrown off moving train while resisting thieves
18.article_body: A woman constable of Bihar Police was on Wednesday thrown off a moving train while she was resisting a theft bid in the state's Katihar district. "Around four miscreants tried to snatch my purse and mobile phone and when I resisted their bid, they pushed me off," the injured constable said in the hospital.

19.title: Ambala tourist, instructor killed as paraglider crashes in Himachal
19.article_body: A tourist from Ambala and a paragliding instructor were killed after their paraglider collided with a hill soon after take-off in Himachal Pradesh's Kullu district. The incident took place in the Dobhi area of the district. Post-mortem is being done in a nearby hospital, Kullu Superintendent of Police (SP) Gurdev Chand Sharma said.

20.title: The Fuel Delivery to soon offer doorstep delivery of CNG in Mumbai
20.article_body: Energy distribution startup The Fuel Delivery will soon begin doorstep delivery of CNG to customers in Mumbai. The service, which will start from places like Sion and Mahape initially, will be extended across the city soon. The startup has signed a Letter of Intent with Mahanagar Gas Limited (MGL) for the round-the-clock service which will begin in next three months.

21.title: Prayagraj police to put up posters of violence accused on roadsides
21.article_body: Police in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj will put up posters of people allegedly involved in the June 10 violence on roadsides and in public places to identify them, officials said. Police will also circulate these posters on social media platforms and their houses will also be attached. The violence broke out after Friday prayers over remarks against Prophet Muhammad.

22.title: Fire breaks out at commercial building in Pune, no casualties reported
22.article_body: A fire broke out in the basement of a commercial building in Pune's Shivajinagar area on Wednesday morning. No casualties were reported due to the fire, which damaged a set of documents of an automobile sales company. Officials suspect that a short circuit in the electrical system in basement could have led to the blaze.

23.title: WHO explores reports of monkeypox virus in semen
23.article_body: The WHO is looking into reports that the monkeypox virus is present in the semen of patients, to check the possibility that the disease could be sexually transmitted, WHO's Catherine Smallwood said. "This may have been something that we were unaware of in this disease before," she said, adding that most frequent mode of transmission is associated with skin-to-skin contact.

24.title: DOGE founder shares 'death knocking' meme to suggest real estate crash, Musk says 'True'
24.article_body: Dogecoin Co-founder Billy Markus has suggested that real estate may be the next thing to collapse after stock and crypto markets. He posted a meme with death opening doors in turn and leaving pools of blood behind each of them. Tesla CEO and the world's richest man Elon Musk replied to the tweet by writing, "True."

25.title: 2.4 mn hectares of winter crops won't be harvested due to war: Ukraine
25.article_body: Ukraine's Agriculture Ministry said around 2.4 million hectares of winter crops with a total value of $1.435 billion will remain unharvested in the country because of Russia's invasion. So far, the agriculture sector has suffered losses of $4.292 billion because of the invasion, it added. Some 92,000 cows and 258,000 pigs have been killed in areas affected by fighting.

26.title: Musk-owned SpaceX's Starship will be ready for orgital flight in July
26.article_body: SpaceX's Starship vehicle will be ready for orbital flight next month, said Founder and CEO Elon Musk in a tweet on Tuesday. "I was in the high bay and mega bay late last night reviewing progress," Musk said in response to a query regarding Starship's orbital flight. "We'll have a second Starship stack ready to fly in August," Musk added.

27.title: Aaditya Thackeray, Shiv Sena leaders perform aarti in Ayodhya's ISKCON Temple
27.article_body: Maharashtra Minister Aaditya Thackeray, along with other Shiv Sena leaders, performed aarti at ISKCON Temple in Ayodhya's Ramnagar on Wednesday. "Recalling the relationship between Hindu Hriday Samrat Balasaheb Thackeray and ISKCON Mumbai," Thackeray tweeted while sharing a video of the aarti. "I am grateful for the invitation and love to visit ISKCON Ramnagar," his tweet further read.

28.title: Ryanair drops Afrikaans nationality test for S Africans amid backlash
28.article_body: Ryanair has dropped a requirement for South African passengers to prove their nationality by taking a test in Afrikaans language. This comes after the move, which was aimed at weeding out fraudulent South African passports, received backlash from the country's government. Afrikaans is spoken by around 12% of South African population and was linked to apartheid era in the country.

29.title: Opposition parties adopt resolution to field common candidate for Presidential election
29.article_body: The leaders of several Opposition parties on Wednesday adopted a resolution to field common candidate for the upcoming Presidential election, TMC chief Mamata Banerjee said. "This is a good beginning. We sat together after several months, and we will do it again," she added. The parties included Congress, Shiv Sena, NCP, SP, PDP, National Conference, RJD and DMK among others.

30.title: Aamir to host reunion party for the team as Lagaan completes 21 yrs: Reports
30.article_body: Aamir Khan will reportedly host a reunion party at his home as Lagaan completed 21 years. To celebrate the legacy of the film, the cast will reunite at Aamir's residence today. Last year, the team had a virtual reunion to celebrate 20 years of the film. Meanwhile, on the professional front, Aamir will be next seen in 'Laal Singh Chaddha'.

31.title: I've aged, I don't show my aggression unless a batter provokes me: Chahal
31.article_body: India spinner Yuzvendra Chahal, on being asked about his subdued wicket celebrations by opener Ruturaj Gaikwad, jokingly said, "Now that I have aged, I don't show my aggression unless a batter provokes me." He added, "It's just a normal celebration...There are friends who are batting at the other end." Chahal registered figures of 3/20 in the third South Africa T20I.

32.title: France captures senior Islamic State member in Mali
32.article_body: French troops in Mali have captured a senior member of the Islamic State militant group, French Armed Forces Ministry said. Oumeya Albakaye was captured on the intervening night of June 11-12 close to the border between Mali and Niger, it added. This comes as France prepares to complete its withdrawal from Mali, where it has been fighting ISIS since 2013.

33.title: Gangsters were born under previous govts in Punjab: AAP's Kejriwal
33.article_body: AAP's Arvind Kejriwal on Wednesday backed current law and order situation in Punjab while speaking at an event in Jalandhar. "I ask...Opposition, has [Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann] brought gangsters with him? These gangsters were born under...previous governments," he said. Kejriwal's comments come amid Opposition's uproar over rising crimes in Punjab following Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala's murder.

34.title: 25-yr-old IAF officer kills self at hostel in Madhya Pradesh
34.article_body: A 25-year-old Indian Air Force (IAF) officer allegedly died by suicide by hanging from a ceiling fan in his hostel room in Madhya Pradesh's Gwalior city on Wednesday. The deceased, identified as Jaidutt Singh, was a flying officer posted in the engineering branch at Maharajpura Air Base in the city. Singh was transferred to Gwalior this year, an official said.

35.title: NZ's Kyle Jamieson ruled out of third England Test with back injury
35.article_body: New Zealand pacer Kyle Jamieson has been ruled out of the third Test against England due to a back injury he picked during the second Test. "Jamieson will return home after an MRI scan revealed a stress-reaction to his lower left-back," said New Zealand's cricket board. Jamieson didn't bowl during England's second innings on Day 5 of the second Test.

36.title: BJP expels Rajasthan MLA for cross-voting in Rajya Sabha polls
36.article_body: BJP on Tuesday expelled MLA Shobharani Kushwah from Rajasthan's Dholpur constituency for cross-voting in the recently-held Rajya Sabha elections. Kushwah was earlier suspended and served a show-cause notice for going against party orders. Notably, the BJP had asked its members to vote for independent candidate Subhash Chandra. However, Kushwah voted for Congress' Pramod Tiwari in the elections.

37.title: Woman, minor sons die after jumping in front of moving train in Delhi
37.article_body: A woman and her minor sons died after they allegedly jumped in front of a moving train in Delhi. Reports said that the incident took place at the Holambi Kalan railway station on Tuesday. The identity of the deceased is yet to be revealed. Reports also said that the police have taken possession of the bodies.

38.title: UP man impersonates Assam Crime Branch official, extorts money from suspects
38.article_body: Assam Police arrested a man from Guwahati’s Beltola area on the charges of impersonating a crime branch inspector to extort money from suspects in criminal cases. The accused, who is from UP, received money from suspects on the promise of influencing the probe and getting them exonerated, SP, Assam CID, Pranab Jyoti Goswami, said.

39.title: Haryana board declares Class 12 results, top 3 ranks secured by girls
39.article_body: The Board of School Education Haryana announced Class 12 results on Wednesday. KCM Senior Secondary School Rohtak's Kajal topped the exam by securing 498 out of 500 marks and the second and third ranks were also bagged by girls. As many as 87.08% of the students cleared the exam. Girls' pass percentage was 90.51%, while it was 83.96% for boys.

40.title: Latest rankings for T20I batters out, India's Ishan Kishan jumps 68 spots
40.article_body: The ICC on Wednesday announced the latest rankings for T20I batters. India's Ishan Kishan jumped 68 spots to break into the top 10. He is now ranked seventh with 689 rating points and is the only Indian batter in the top 10. Further, Pakistan's Mohammad Rizwan jumped a spot to be ranked second with 794 rating points.

41.title: Quit acting after my debut film which was a super-duper hit: Suchitra
41.article_body: Discussing her decision to quit acting for a few years, actress Suchitra Krishnamoorthi said, "I quit after my debut film ['Kabhi Haan Kabhi Naa' which starred Shah Rukh Khan and]...was a super-duper hit." Suchitra added her parents and ex-husband, director Shekhar Kapur who directed the original 'Mr India' didn't want her to act which is why she gave up acting.

42.title: Cong's Sachin Pilot detained amid protests over Rahul’s questioning by ED
42.article_body: Congress leader Sachin Pilot was detained on his way to Congress headquarters on Wednesday amid protests over Rahul Gandhi’s questioning by the ED. Gandhi appeared before the ED for the third consecutive day today in connection with the National Herald case. Earlier today, Congress workers and leaders protesting against ED questioning were detained by the police outside the AICC office.

43.title: 60-yr-old arrested for sexually assaulting minor girl in Hyd
43.article_body: Hyderabad Police arrested a 60-year-old man on Tuesday night for allegedly misbehaving with a minor girl. According to the police officer, the accused runs a general store and touched the minor inappropriately when she had gone to purchase some products. The girl, who was in a state of shock, informed her parents, following which a case was registered.

44.title: Photographer recreates pic of Arctic region after 104 years to show melting glacier
44.article_body: Photographer Neill Drake has recreated a 1918 photo of Blomstrandbreen Glacier in the Arctic region to show how much of it has melted. "I knew that the message that this photo represented meant a whole lot more than just how accurate the boat position and mountain peaks were," he said. He added the photo was meant to make people uncomfortable.

45.title: How will BCCI distribute ₹48,390-crore fetched from IPL media rights?
45.article_body: BCCI will distribute half of ₹48,390-crore fetched from IPL media rights between the eight original franchises. The remaining half will be shared with players and state associations. As per a report, 26% of the remaining half will be distributed among domestic and international players, while 4% has been earmarked for staff salaries and the state associations will get remaining 70%.

46.title: Dad jokes about me marrying Telugu guy, don't think I'll wed soon: Sai Pallavi
46.article_body: Actress Sai Pallavi said that her father jokes about her marrying a Telugu guy. Talking about her marriage plans, she said, "I've got so used to speaking Telugu at home." "I don't think it'll happen anytime soon. Right now, I'm happy being alone and I'm trying to know about myself more. I'm on that journey," she added.

47.title: Ruthless suppression of Cong's protests is blot on our democracy: Tharoor
47.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Wednesday said the "ruthless" suppression of the Congress party’s protests is a "blot" on our democracy. His statement came as Rahul Gandhi appeared before the ED for the third consecutive day today. Congress workers and leaders protesting against ED questioning were also detained by the police outside the AICC office earlier today.

48.title: PM Modi to address public meeting in Hyderabad on July 3
48.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will address a public meeting in Hyderabad on July 3 after the culmination of the BJP's national executive meeting in the city. Initially, it was proposed that PM Modi would take up a roadshow in the city. The BJP's national executive meeting will be held on July 2 and 3.

49.title: Kangana's 'Dhaakad', made at ₹85 crore budget, earns only ₹2.58 crore: Report
49.article_body: Kangana Ranaut's 'Dhaakad', which was made on an estimated budget of ₹85 crore, managed to earn a lifetime collection of ₹2.58 crore at the box office in India, as per Bollywood Hungama. The report added that the producers are facing ₹78 crore loss. It said that the producers will have to now sell satellite and digital rights at throwaway prices.

50.title: Anupam Kher posts video of travelling on Purvanchal Expressway, says 'Like US highways'
50.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher on Wednesday shared a video of his travel on the Purvanchal Expressway on his way from Lucknow to Varanasi on Twitter. He wrote, "Travelling on Purvanchal Express inaugurated recently by PM Narendra Modi is like any European or American freeways/highways. Makes me feel so proud." He added, "Kudos to Nitin Gadkari ji, Yogi Adityanath and entire team."

51.title: Natalie's character not at most exciting version in previous Thor films: Taika
51.article_body: 'Thor: Love and Thunder' director Taika Waititi, speaking about Natalie Portman's character in previous 'Thor' films, said, "It's...not the most exciting version of the female character that we want from these films." He added he talked to Natalie about changing her character in 'Thor: Love and Thunder'. He said he wanted to make her character adventurous and fun.

52.title: 4, including 2 minors, killed after SUV collides with tanker in UP
52.article_body: Four people, including two minors, were killed and two others sustained injuries when an SUV collided with a tanker on Purvanchal Expressway in Uttar Pradesh's Sultanpur district. The incident took place on Tuesday night when the car was on its way to Lucknow from Ballia, police said. Injured persons have been admitted to a hospital for treatment, an official said.

53.title: Thailand opposition parties file no-confidence motion against PM
53.article_body: Thailand's opposition parties filed a no-confidence motion against PM Prayut Chan-o-cha and 10 cabinet ministers. They have accused the leaders of corruption, economic mismanagement and undermining democracy. "[Prayut] is a leader that has a flawed thinking, likes to cling to power, does not respect the rule of law, lacks morals and failed in managing state affairs," said an opposition leader.

54.title: Joe Root becomes world number one Test batter, 2 Indians in top 10
54.article_body: The ICC today released the latest rankings for Test batters, with Joe Root reclaiming the top spot. Root is now on top of the rankings with 897 rating points. He overtook Marnus Labuschagne, who has 892 rating points. Eighth-ranked Rohit Sharma and 10th-ranked Virat Kohli are the two Indians in top 10.

55.title: Akshay Kumar is very passionate about 'Oh My God 2': Yami Gautam
55.article_body: Actress Yami Gautam, speaking about working with Akshay Kumar in 'Oh My God 2', has said, "He's a very good producer also...someone who is very passionate about this film." "When I was given the narration, I could feel that he really wants to make it with the right team," she added. Yami also called Pankaj Tripathi a "fantastic actor".

56.title: BJP govt making armed forces its laboratory for experiments: Priyanka
56.article_body: A day after the Union government announced the 'Agnipath' scheme for recruitment to the armed forces, Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra asked why the BJP was making the armed forces its laboratory for experiments. "Soldiers serving the army for several years, does the government see this as a burden?" Priyanka's Twitter post read.

57.title: Not political, it's for religious purpose: Aaditya Thackeray on Ayodhya visit
57.article_body: Maharashtra Minister Aaditya Thackeray on Wednesday visited Ayodhya to offer prayers at the Ram temple and said his visit to the temple is not for political benefits. "Shiv Sena leaders and I've visited here for religious purpose...there's no political benefit," he said. Sena leaders Sanjay Raut and Eknath Shinde along with over 1,000 Shiv Sainiks reached Ayodhya for Aaditya's visit.

58.title: Duplicate Surf Excel manufacturing unit busted in Greater Noida
58.article_body: A factory manufacturing fake Surf Excel detergent powder was busted in Greater Noida and one person was arrested in connection with the case, police said on Wednesday. Besides raw material, over 10,000 sachets of 80-gm weight having the label of Hindustan Unilever's Surf Excel brand and over 32,000 unprinted sachets of the same size were seized, a police spokesperson said.

59.title: Ukraine suffering painful losses, needs anti-missile weapons: Zelenskyy
59.article_body: Ukrainian forces are suffering painful losses in fighting Russian troops in the east of the country, Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said on Tuesday. He added that Ukraine now needs modern anti-missile weapons and there could be no justification for partner countries to delay delivery. Zelenskyy also said that some Russian rockets are evading Ukrainian defences and causing casualties.

60.title: Hate being categorised as an actor, dislike being put in a box: Radhika
60.article_body: Sharing her opinion on actors being categorised on the basis of mediums they work in, actress Radhika Apte said she "hates" being categorised, adding she doesn't like being "put in a box". "That doesn't mean I can stop people from doing that," stated Radhika. Actor Vikrant Massey said being categorised as an actor bothers him, adding it is unfair.

61.title: Cong to gherao all Raj Bhawans over claims of police entering party office
61.article_body: Congress leader Randeep Singh Surjewala said the party will gherao all Raj Bhawans across India on Thursday to protest against Delhi Police entering Congress' Delhi headquarters and beating up workers. Several Congress leaders and workers have been protesting outside the party office and ED headquarters since Monday. They're protesting over summons to Rahul Gandhi in National Herald case.

62.title: Send questions via mail: Naveen Jindal to Thane police over Prophet remarks
62.article_body: Expelled BJP leader Naveen Kumar Jindal failed to appear before Bhiwandi Police in Maharashtra's Thane on Wednesday in a case over his alleged derogatory tweets against Prophet Muhammad. Jindal sent a mail to police, saying he was unwell and medically unfit to travel. He asked police to send him questions and he'll respond to them via email through his lawyer.

63.title: Harshal has done everything he can to be in India's squad for T20 WC: Irfan
63.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Irfan Pathan has said pacer Harshal Patel has done everything he can to be part of India's squad for the T20 World Cup later this year. "I understand playing in Australia...you need extra pace...[but] he has been outstanding as far as variation is concerned," stated Irfan. Harshal registered figures of 4/25 in the third T20I against South Africa.

64.title: Kejriwal, Mann flag off Jalandhar-Delhi airport Volvo bus service
64.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and his Punjab counterpart Bhagwant Mann on Wednesday flagged off a government-run Volvo bus service connecting Jalandhar to Delhi's IGI airport. The ceremony, which took place at Jalandhar's Shaheed Bhagat Singh Interstate Bus Terminal, was also attended by Punjab Transport Minister Laljit Bhullar. "This marks...end of private transport mafia in Punjab," AAP tweeted.

65.title: Canada ends COVID-19 vaccine mandate for domestic, int'l travel
65.article_body: The Canadian government has announced that it will end COVID-19 vaccine requirement for domestic and international travel from June 20. The decision comes following concerns over hours-long delays at airports. Though the vaccine mandate has been withdrawn for trains and flights, the passengers would still be required to wear masks while travelling.

66.title: Centre will pay hefty price for suppressing Rahul Gandhi’s voice: CM Baghel
66.article_body: Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel criticised BJP-led Central government over ED's probe against Congress leader Rahul Gandhi in the National Herald case. The centre will have to pay a hefty price for attempting to suppress Gandhi's voice, Baghel said. "Be it GST, demonetisation, COVID mismanagement...unemployment...Gandhi has been raising...voice against every important issue," he added.

67.title: FIR against Maha Cong leader for derogatory comments about PM Modi
67.article_body: An FIR was registered in Nagpur against Maharashtra Congress leader Sheikh Hussain for allegedly using derogatory language against PM Narendra Modi. "I've not made any personal attack against the PM, only used an idiom in my speech. I spoke in favour of the party. I've not said anything I regret or need to apologise for," he said.

68.title: This is huge, I feel such pride: Janhvi Kapoor on Brahmastra's trailer
68.article_body: Janhvi Kapoor reacted to Brahmastra's trailer that was released earlier today. Taking to Instagram Stories, Janhvi wrote, "This is huge!!! A first for Hindi cinema. Feel such pride to finally see a glimpse of this spectacular vision!! Truly a world like we've never seen before." Alia Bhatt shared the trailer on Instagram and wrote, "A piece of our hearts, 'Brahmastra'."

69.title: Man puts salt in eyes & gets blindfolded, paints Sonu Sood's pic; actor reacts
69.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood shared a video of a man who allegedly put salt in his eyes and got blindfolded before painting the actor's picture at an event. In the video, the man can be seen painting Sood's picture upside down. Several people can be seen looking while the man paints the picture. "What wonderful man," Sonu wrote on Twitter.

70.title: 350-pound bear euthanised after attacking 3-yr-old girl, her mother
70.article_body: A 350-pound black bear was euthanised after ripping into a family's tent and injuring a mother and her three-year-old daughter in the US. The bear allegedly tore through the sleeping family's tent at 5:20 am on Sunday and scratched the mother and the daughter, causing superficial head lacerations. The child's father managed to scare off the bear after several attempts.

71.title: Latest rankings for ODI batters out, Kohli drops out of top 2 for first time after 5 years
71.article_body: The ICC today released the latest rankings for ODI batters, with Virat Kohli dropping to the third position. It is for the first time in five years that Kohli has dropped out of the first two positions. Pakistan captain Babar Azam remains at the number one spot, while his compatriot Imam-ul-Haq is now the world number two ODI batter.

72.title: Video shows Varun, Kiara eating vada pav in Mumbai Metro; fans react
72.article_body: A video of Varun Dhawan and Kiara Advani eating vada pav in a metro in Mumbai while promoting their film 'Jugjugg Jeeyo' went viral on social media. As per Mumbai Metro rules, eating is not allowed inside the metro. "Are eatables allowed inside the...metro?" an Instagram user commented. Another user commented, "Eating isn't allowed...VIP treatment."

73.title: Hyderabad receives rainfall, IMD forecasts more rain till June 18
73.article_body: Rains lashed Hyderabad on Wednesday morning and Kandikal Gate of Bandlaguda Mandal received the highest rainfall at 53.3 mm, as per the Telangana State Development Planning Society. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted light to moderate rainfall in the city from June 16 to 18. Southwest Monsoon arrived in Hyderabad on Monday.

74.title: Which are the world's top 10 airlines by customer experience?
74.article_body: Qatar Airways is world's best airline, according to Skytrax. It is followed by Singapore Airlines, ANA: All Nippon Airways, Emirates and Japan Airlines. Cathay Pacific has been ranked 6th, followed by EVA Air, Qantas Airways, Hainan Airlines and Air France. The rankings are based on customer survey period from September 2019 to July 2021.

75.title: Great Indian hornbill tortured before being killed in Nagaland; 3 held as video surfaces
75.article_body: A great Indian hornbill was tortured and beaten with a stick before being killed in Nagaland's Wokha district. Police have arrested three people after the video of the incident was widely shared on social media. "It is indeed too cruel and insane to have acted in such a manner and the culprits should be booked," an NGO said.

76.title: I am not really interested in winning a Grammy: BTS member Jungkook
76.article_body: South Korean boy band BTS' member Jungkook said while he knows that winning a Grammy award is a "huge" deal, he is "not really" interested in actually winning one. "I think our status is there whether we win a Grammy or not," added Jungkook. Talking about his voice, Jungkook stated, "There's a lot of times when I don't like it."

77.title: Are we terrorists?: Adhir Ranjan as police detain protesting Cong leaders
77.article_body: As Congress leader Rahul Gandhi appeared for the third day before the Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Wednesday, party workers and leaders protesting against the ED questioning were detained by police outside the AICC office. "Are we terrorists? Why are you scared of us? They are using police force against Congress leaders and workers," Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury said.

78.title: Wouldn't have gone anyway: Owaisi on not being invited to Opposition meet
78.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Wednesday said he wasn't invited to the meeting of Opposition leaders called by TMC chief Mamata Banerjee in Delhi. "Even if I were invited, I wouldn't have participated," Owaisi added, stating Congress to be the reason behind his decision. Notably, Mamata Banerjee had invited leaders of 22 political parties to discuss strategy for Presidential election.

79.title: Risk of US recession probably at 50% now: Morgan Stanley CEO
79.article_body: The risk of a recession in the US is at about 50%, said Morgan Stanley CEO James Gorman. An economic downturn could "fatally damage" some institutions, Gorman said and added that any such decline would likely be short-lived. My focus in more on non-financial risks like data stability, cyber and operations risk, he further said.

80.title: Been told my scripts are 'too much LGBT', don't know what that means: Onir
80.article_body: Filmmaker Onir said that he has been told by platforms that his scripts are 'too much LGBT'. "I don't know what that means," he said, adding, "I am called for Pride webinars...The platforms promise that they will reach out, but I keep sending scripts after the webinar, but don't get any response."

81.title: Telugu subject compulsory for class 1 to 10 in Telangana schools
81.article_body: Telangana government has mandated Telugu as a second language for students of CBSE, ICSE, IB and other board-affiliated schools from Class 1 to 10 starting this academic year. Accordingly, two Telugu textbooks, one for Telugu-speaking students and the other for students whose mother tongue is not Telugu have been designed. Non-compliance with the rule will have repercussions, the circular stated.

82.title: 'Solve dispute in lifetime' approach won’t work with India-China matter: RSS leader
82.article_body: RSS leader Ram Madhav said the approach of 'I should solve this dispute in my lifetime' will not work in the India-China border issue. "Don't be in a hurry for a (Indo-China boundary) solution…It's not going to be solved, because you are not dealing with just any other country, you are dealing with a civilisation, a cultural nation," he added.

83.title: BBMP issues COVID-19 advisories for schools, parents after students test +ve
83.article_body: Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has issued a set of advisories for schools and parents after 31 students tested COVID-19 positive at two schools. In an advisory, BBMP directed schools to mandatorily conduct thermal screening for all students and staff at the entrance. In another advisory issued for parents, BBMP urged all eligible members in the house to get vaccinated.

84.title: Kept taking my chances: Ruturaj Gaikwad on scoring 5 fours in an over
84.article_body: Talking about scoring five fours in an over during the third T20I against South Africa, opener Ruturaj Gaikwad said, "That (Anrich Nortje over) was the fifth over of the powerplay and...we wanted to...get as many runs as possible." "I...kept...taking my chances and didn't think that we have 10 runs in the over already so I should stop," added Ruturaj.

85.title: UN cuts food aid to 17 lakh people in South Sudan amid funding crisis
85.article_body: At least 17 lakh people in South Sudan will lose access to food aid as the UN World Food Programme (WFP) has suspended its assistance citing a shortage of funds. Among those affected are 1.78 lakh children who will no longer receive school meals, WFP said. Over 60% of the country's population faces severe food insecurity, according to the WFP.

86.title: PM greeted with 'Modi, Modi' chants as 50k people gather to see him in Pune
86.article_body: PM Narendra Modi was greeted with chants of 'Modi, Modi', 'Har Har Mahadev' and 'Jai Shree Ram' as he addressed a gathering after inaugurating the Shila temple in Pune's Dehu on Tuesday. Around 50,000 people from Dehu and adjacent villages had gathered to see PM Modi. He inaugurated Sant Tukaram Temple in Dehu.

87.title: 'Agniveers' to get priority in police recruitment in UP: CM Yogi
87.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Wednesday said 'Agniveers', soldiers who are recruited in the Army, Navy and the Air Force under the 'Agnipath' scheme, will get priority in recruitment to police and related services in the state. "The double-engine government of BJP is dedicated and committed for...upliftment of...youth," Yogi tweeted. Under the scheme, youngsters will be recruited for four years.

88.title: India's trade deficit in May at record $24.3 bn, exports rise 20.55%
88.article_body: India's merchandise exports in May rose 20.55% to $38.94 billion while the trade deficit rose to a record $24.29 billion, up from $6.53 billion recorded in May 2021, according to government data released on Wednesday.  Imports in May grew 62.83% to $63.22 billion. Cumulative exports and imports between April 2022-May 2023 rose to $78.72 billion and $123.41 billion respectively.

89.title: Video shows Delhi Police entering Congress HQ, police say 'people threw barricades at us'
89.article_body: Congress has shared a video of Delhi Police personnel entering the party's headquarters amid protests over Enforcement Directorate's questioning of Rahul Gandhi. Calling it a "criminal trespass", Congress alleged policemen also thrashed its workers. Delhi Police said that many people threw barricades at the police near the Congress office but denied that policemen entered the office or used force.

90.title: Ruturaj deserves praise as he played with people behind him to take his spot: Jaffer
90.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said India opener Ruturaj Gaikwad deserves praise for his 57-run innings in the third South Africa T20I as he played "with a lot of people sitting behind him to take his spot". Jaffer added, "You've [got] to praise Gaikwad for the way he batted after not being able to score in the first two matches."

91.title: LinkedIn, UN Women partner to advance women empowerment in India
91.article_body: LinkedIn on Wednesday announced partnership with United Nations Women to advance women's economic empowerment in Asia Pacific, beginning with the state of Maharashtra. The LINK Women Project will begin with a 15-month pilot to cultivate the digital, soft and employability skills of 2,000 women. Women who have completed higher education can participate in the project.

92.title: I did do horrible things throughout my relationship, behaved in horrible ways: Amber
92.article_body: In a new interview since Johnny Depp's defamation trial verdict, Amber Heard said the trial was the most "horrible and humiliating" thing she has been through. "I made a lot of mistakes, but I've always told the truth," she added. "I did do and say horrible...things throughout my relationship. I behaved in horrible...ways. I have so much regret," said Amber.

93.title: 455 booked for drunken driving in Noida, Greater Noida in a day
93.article_body: Over 450 people were booked in a day for drunken driving across Noida and Greater Noida in UP, police said on Wednesday. Vehicles and suspicious-looking people were checked during the process, which led to the police penalising 455 people, 181 people in Noida, 224 in central Noida and 50 in Greater Noida.

94.title: Thieves cut open ATM kiosk in Delhi’s Satya Niketan, steal ₹20 lakh
94.article_body: Some unidentified men reportedly cut open an ATM kiosk using a gas cutter in Southwest Delhi's Satya Niketan and stole ₹20 lakh on early Wednesday. "The accused...used a spray on the lens of CCTV cameras...They then used a gas cutter to weaken the base of the ATM and...cut open the iron chest...which had all the cash," police said.

95.title: People walk on hot coal at Switzerland event, treated for burns
95.article_body: As many as 25 people were treated for burn injuries after they walked on hot coal at a private event in Switzerland, said police. The injured were treated at the scene and 13 of them, who suffered severe injuries, were later hospitalised. It was not immediately known why the people walked over hot coal.

96.title: Wife catches her husband with his lover in Chhattisgarh, forces them to parade half-naked
96.article_body: A woman caught her husband with his lover and forced them to parade half-naked in Kondagaon district in Chhattisgarh. After a video of the incident surfaced online, the police arrested her and three others. As per reports, the man and his lover were beaten before being paraded with their hands tied.

97.title: AIIMS issues advisory as man chokes to death while eating momos, says 'swallow with care'
97.article_body: The AIIMS in Delhi has issued a 'swallow with care' warning after a 50-year-old man choked to death while eating momos, according to its forensic department. It advised chewing momos properly instead of just swallowing them. "Virtual autopsy of the deceased indicated that choking occurs when a foreign body is too large to gain access into the trachea," it stated.

98.title: Uma Bharti throws cow dung at liquor shop in MP; video surfaces
98.article_body: BJP leader Uma Bharti on Tuesday threw cow dung at a liquor shop in Madhya Pradesh's Orchha town amid her demand for total prohibition in the BJP-ruled state. Bharti in a tweet claimed the shop wasn't approved for the spot it was located. It was a "crime" to open such an outlet in the holy town of Orchha, she said.

99.title: Republican Congressman who voted to impeach Donald Trump ousted
99.article_body: Republican Congressman Tom Rice, who voted to impeach former US President Donald Trump after the January 6 Capitol riot, lost his re-election bid in South Carolina on Tuesday. Rice, a five-term South Carolina incumbent, was beaten in a primary election by Trump-backed challenger Russell Fry. Meanwhile, another Republican Nancy Mace who had criticised Trump won the election.

100.title: Vir Das tests +ve for COVID for 2nd time, says 'Woke up with symptoms'
100.article_body: Ahead of his show in Gujarat, actor-comedian Vir Das has tested positive for COVID-19 for the second time. "Woke up showing symptoms, rapid tested and now going to get RT-PCR tested," Vir wrote on Instagram. "Team is currently working on new dates for the Gujarat show," he added. Earlier, Vir had tested positive for COVID-19 in January this year.

101.title: Abortions rose in US, 1 in 5 pregnancies terminated in 2020: Study
101.article_body: About one in five pregnancies in the US ended in abortion in 2020, said a report by the Guttmacher Institute's researchers. The number and rate of abortions in the country rose in 2020 as compared to 2017, it added. While over 8.62 lakh abortions were recorded in 2017, more than 9.3 lakh were seen in 2020.

102.title: 240-metre-long glass bridge with diamond-shaped cafe in middle opens in Georgia
102.article_body: The opening ceremony of the 240-metre-long glass bridge - with a diamond-shaped cafe in the middle - over the Tsalka canyon in Georgia's Tsalka was held on June 14. Pictures of the bridge and the cafe went viral on social media. The project was carried out by the Jewish company Kass Group.

103.title: Veterinary doctor called to check on sick animal kidnapped and forcibly married in Bihar
103.article_body: In a case of 'Pakadua Vivah', a veterinary doctor was kidnapped and forcibly married in Bihar's Begusarai after being called to check on a sick animal. The veterinarian was abducted by three people. "We've asked SHO and other officials to conduct an investigation into the matter. Strict actions will be taken against the accused," said Yogendra Kumar, SP, Begusarai.

104.title: Mumbai receives light drizzle; monsoon spell not expected till June 20: IMD
104.article_body: Light rains were witnessed in South Mumbai, Dadar and a few other areas across Mumbai on Wednesday. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) predicts that Mumbai will receive light rains on Thursday too. It also stated that no active monsoon spell is expected in the city at least till June 20, despite the onset of the southwest monsoon.

105.title: Pics shown on TV, whole life put on display: Javed's daughter on demolition
105.article_body: Prayagraj violence accused Javed Mohammed's daughter Sumaiya Fatima said that photographs were being shown on television when her house was being demolished. "The anchors were pointing towards each item...our whole life was put on display in front of everyone to see and devour. Our memories are attached to those things, but they had no respect for it," she added.

106.title: You can't keep your bat quiet for too long: Irfan on Pant's form
106.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Irfan Pathan has said wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant "has got stuck a lot" in T20Is and needs to perform in the upcoming games. "Time might come [when] you might have to work hard to play in the XI...You already have Karthik and Ishan as wicketkeepers," added Irfan. "You cannot keep your bat quiet for too long," he further said.

107.title: First UK deportation flight to Rwanda cancelled after legal action
107.article_body: The first deportation flight of asylum seekers from the UK to Rwanda was cancelled minutes before take-off on Tuesday after a ruling from the European Court of Human Rights (ECHR). ECHR said the plan carried "a real risk of irreversible harm" to asylum seekers. Britain in April signed a deal with Rwanda to send illegal migrants to the African nation.

108.title: Kamal Haasan meets Tamil Nadu CM Stalin after the success of 'Vikram'
108.article_body: Actor Kamal Haasan met Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin after the success of his film 'Vikram'. The actor took to Twitter to share a picture with the CM. Earlier, actor Chiranjeevi hosted the film's success party and actor Salman Khan had also attended the party. The film has earned over ₹300 crore globally.

109.title: Struggling to find words for what we witnessed: Stokes on 5-wicket win vs NZ
109.article_body: England Test captain Ben Stokes said he can't find words to describe his feelings after their five-wicket win against New Zealand in the second Test. "[This] blows away Headingley Test [during the Ashes 2019], it blows away the 2019 World Cup final. Just emotionally and the enjoyment of every minute I had on that field, it was incredible," stated Stokes.

110.title: 38-yr-old man robs house in Maharashtra after watching YouTube video, arrested
110.article_body: Police arrested a 38-year-old man from UP for allegedly stealing cash and jewellery worth ₹9.75 lakh after breaking into a house in Maharashtra’s Palghar, an official said. He has no previous criminal record, ACP, Zone-II, Pankaj Shirsat, said. During questioning, the accused told that he learnt about the house-breaking theft from a YouTube video, the official said.

111.title: Agnipath scheme will make army fitter: Vice Chief of Army Staff
111.article_body: Vice Chief of Army Staff BS Raju on Wednesday said the newly launched Agnipath scheme for recruitment in armed forces will lower the average age of soldiers from 32-33 years to approximately 26 years in about 8-10 years. "It'll make the army fitter. We'll be able to handle more challenging situations in difficult areas that troops operate in," he added.

112.title: Tihar authorities to induct dog squad to curb drug, SIM smuggling
112.article_body: Tihar authorities in Delhi are planning to deploy a four-member dog squad to curb smuggling of banned items inside the prison. Accordingly, the dogs will be trained to detect mobile phones, weapons, SIM cards, drugs and tobacco which prisoners carry in their stomach and vomit out on reaching inside. It will be later expanded to Rohini and Mandoli jails.

113.title: Akshay seems to be disinterested in 'Samrat Prithviraj': Komal Nahta
113.article_body: Trade expert Komal Nahta, speaking about the box office failure of 'Samrat Prithviraj', said that it was a dangerous project as historical films are always tricky. "Akshay Kumar seems to be totally disinterested. He looked like Akshay Kumar rather than Prithviraj," he added. "Film had bad music...lastly, it didn't invoke any feeling of patriotism," he added.

114.title: Don't tolerate any disrespect after breakup with Bieber: Selena Gomez
114.article_body: Singer-actress Selena Gomez opened up about her break-up with singer Justin Bieber. "It allowed me to develop a character where I don't tolerate any sort of nonsense or disrespect," she stated. Selena and Justin broke up in 2018. A few months later after his break-up, Justin tied the knot with model Hailey Bieber.

115.title: SA were completely out of 3rd T20I by the time Chahal bowled 3 overs: Nehra
115.article_body: Discussing Yuzvendra Chahal's spell in the third T20I against South Africa where he picked three wickets while conceding 20 runs, Ashish Nehra said South Africa were completely out of the match by the time Chahal bowled three overs. "We...[saw] the Chahal...we know, the aggressive Chahal. He varied his pace and length the way he...does when...at his best," added Nehra.

116.title: UAE bans export of Indian wheat till September
116.article_body: The UAE has imposed a moratorium on the export and re-export of wheat and wheat flour from India for four months starting from May 13. The UAE said this decision comes in view of international developments that have affected trade flows and in appreciation of the strategic relations after India's approval to export wheat to the UAE for domestic consumption.

117.title: Covaxin booster dose enhances efficacy against Delta, Omicron variants: Study
117.article_body: A booster dose of COVID-19 vaccine Covaxin enhances its efficacy against Delta variant and Omicron variants namely, BA.1.1 and BA.2, a study stated. "In vaccine efficacy study against the Omicron variants...lesser virus shedding, lung viral load and lung disease severity were observed," the paper stated. Reduction in lung viral load and lung lesions were observed in Delta variant, it added.

118.title: What is the I2U2 group that comprises India, US?
118.article_body: US has announced a new group named I2U2, which comprises India, Israel, US and UAE. "India is a massive consumer market. It is a massive producer of high-tech and highly sought-after goods as well. So, there are a number of areas where these countries can work together, whether its technology, trade, climate...and potentially even security as well," US said.

119.title: National security being toyed with: Cong over Agnipath recruitment scheme
119.article_body: Congress leader TS Singh Deo on Tuesday questioned the central government's Agnipath recruitment scheme for youth to serve in the Army. "Defence services and national security are being toyed with," Deo said. "What kind of job is this where you'll keep them for four years and then only 25% of them would be allowed to go ahead?" he added.

120.title: Zomato-backed Shiprocket to acquire Pickrr for $200 million
120.article_body: Zomato-backed logistics aggregator Shiprocket has agreed to acquire a majority stake in Pickrr in an estimated $200 million deal comprising cash, stock and earn-out. Pickrr Founders Gaurav Mangla, Ankit Kaushik and Rhitiman Majumder are getting shares in Shiprocket as part of the deal. Shiprocket is also reportedly in the final stages of closing acquisition of the India business of Shyplite.

121.title: Stalin, Thackeray, KCR among leaders to skip Oppn’s meet: Kharge
121.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin, Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao, Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray and many big leaders won’t be participating in the Opposition’s meeting, Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge said on Wednesday. West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee last week wrote to leaders of 22 parties for the meeting to discuss the Presidential election.

122.title: UP CM asks ministers to refrain from making provocative statements
122.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Tuesday asked his ministers to refrain from making provocative statements on any issue that may vitiate the social atmosphere. "Those in government offices should uphold dignity and decorum of their offices," CM Yogi added. He was addressing a meeting of his council of ministers ahead of the bypoll to the two Lok Sabha seats.

123.title: Mumbai airport becomes 1st in India to use wind energy for consumption needs
123.article_body: Mumbai's Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport has become the first in India to explore utilisation of wind energy for consumption purposes. Under the pilot project, a vertical axis wind turbine (VAWT) unit and solar hybrid (solar mill) have been installed at the airport. According to an official, the technology is expected to generate minimum energy of 36 kWh per day.

124.title: J&K bans schools run by Trust affiliated to Jamaat-e-Islami
124.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir administration has ordered a ban on schools run by Falah-e-Aam Trust (FAT), an affiliate of proscribed organisation Jamaat-e-Islami. It has asked the district authorities to seal all such schools within 15 days. The students studying in these institutions have been asked to get admissions in nearby government schools.

125.title: Stokes said 'Don't even think of hitting on ground': Bairstow on 136 (92)
125.article_body: England batter Jonny Bairstow said Ben Stokes asked him "not" to "even think" about hitting the ball on the ground during his 136 off 92, in England's second innings of the second Test against New Zealand. Bairstow smashed the second-fastest century in Tests by an English cricketer during his innings. He reached the three-figure mark in 77 balls.

126.title: India's 2nd-string squad should be appreciated: Inzamam-ul-Haq
126.article_body: Ex-Pakistan captain Inzamam-ul-Haq has said India should be "appreciated" for keeping the five-match T20I series alive against South Africa after their win on Tuesday. "This shows India's depth. The second-string team is putting up a fight and it's great to see that," he stated. India won the third T20I by 48 runs with Ruturaj Gaikwad and Ishan Kishan scoring half-centuries.

127.title: India's first private train service under Bharat Gaurav scheme flagged off
127.article_body: India's first-ever private train service under Bharat Gaurav scheme flagged off on Tuesday from Coimbatore to Shirdi. "Railways has leased this train to a service provider for a period of two years. It has a total of 20 coaches including first, second and third class AC coaches and sleeper coaches," said B Guganesan, CPRO, Southern Railway.

128.title: Shraddha Kapoor's brother Siddhanth shares first pic after getting bail in drugs case
128.article_body: Actress Shraddha Kapoor's brother Siddhanth Kapoor took to Instagram to share his first photo after getting bail in drugs case. In the photo, he can be seen sitting on a flight. He also gave his official statement regarding the case. "I was at the hotel and there was an investigation going on. I have been cooperating," he said.

129.title: I was so lost: Actor Bradley Cooper on his cocaine addiction
129.article_body: Hollywood actor Bradley Cooper opened up about the drug and alcohol addiction he developed after being relegated to a guest star in the third season of his show 'Alias'. "I was so lost...addicted to cocaine...I severed my Achilles tendon right after I got fired-slash-quit 'Alias'," Bradley stated. Bradley added a "hard conversation" with his friend Will Arnett changed his life.

130.title: Man dies after sliding boat hits him at water park in Jharkhand
130.article_body: A 30-year-old man reportedly died after a sliding boat hit him on the head at a water amusement park in Jharkhand's East Singhbhum district on Tuesday. He was declared dead at the hospital. According to police, the park was overcrowded with no arrangements to tackle the crowd. The park has been sealed and police have taken its manager into custody.

131.title: Switzerland closes airspace for security reasons after computer glitch
131.article_body: Swiss airspace was closed for security reasons on Wednesday after a computer glitch with the air traffic control system grounded flights at the country's main airports, officials said. The air traffic control system Skyguide said it "regrets the incident and its consequences for the clients, partners and passengers, and is working flat out to find a solution".

132.title: Abhishek Bachchan, Saiyami Kher's 1st look from R Balki's Ghoomer out
132.article_body: Saiyami Kher shared a picture with Abhishek Bachchan on Twitter revealing the first look from R Balki's 'Ghoomer'. "A project with some of the nicest people I've met. That let me play a sport that I love. That let me play one of the most challenging roles I've played thus far," Saiyami tweeted. Shabana Azmi also features in the film.

133.title: Rahul Gandhi arrives at ED office for third day of questioning
133.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday arrived at the Enforcement Directorate (ED) office in Delhi for the third consecutive day of questioning in connection with the National Herald case. Meanwhile, women leaders and workers of Congress protested against the ED's action outside the party office in heavy police presence. Gandhi was questioned for several hours on Tuesday.

134.title: 6 injured after speeding water tanker hits them in Delhi's Badarpur
134.article_body: At least six people were injured after a speeding water tanker hit them in Delhi's Badarpur market on Tuesday. According to the police, the tanker driver lost control of the vehicle and hit the crowd. Vegetable carts and vehicles were also damaged in the incident. A case of rash driving and negligence has been registered against the driver, police said.

135.title: 42-year-old man dies after his bike collides with PMPML bus in Pune
135.article_body: A 42-year-old man died of serious head injuries after his motorbike collided head-on with a Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) bus at Padmavati chowk on the Pune-Satara road on Tuesday afternoon. The victim's body has been sent for postmortem. "The PMPML bus has been seized and is at Sahakar Nagar Police Station," police sub-inspector Mahesh Nalavade said.

136.title: Cryptocurrency exchange Coinbase fires 8% of its India staff
136.article_body: Cryptocurrency exchange Coinbase's decision to cut its workforce will see around 8% of the company's staff being laid off in India, Coinbase’s Senior Director for Market Expansion Durgesh Kaushik said. Coinbase had announced on Tuesday that it is laying off 18% of its workforce worldwide, citing "economic downturn". Earlier in June, Coinbase had extended its hiring freeze.

137.title: Get your s*** together: DOGE co-creator to Twitter on banning meme creators
137.article_body: Dogecoin Co-creator Billy Markus shared a meme on Twitter against the platform banning meme creators, saying, "Get your s*** together Twitter." Markus shared the Drake meme suggesting Twitter is inclined to ban meme creators instead of scammers and spam bot accounts. Earlier this month, Twitter reportedly agreed to comply with Elon Musk's demand to share data on bots.

138.title: 2-year-old brutally beaten, punched by maid in Madhya Pradesh; video surfaces
138.article_body: Police in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur have arrested a maid for brutally beating and punching a two-year-old when the kid's parents went out to work. The kid's parents installed a CCTV camera after a doctor found that the child's internal organs were swollen. The maid, identified as Rajini Chaudhury, was hired for a monthly payment of ₹5,000.

139.title: Khalistani posters spotted in Punjab's Jalandhar ahead of Arvind Kejriwal's visit
139.article_body: Khalistani posters were spotted in Punjab on Wednesday, ahead of Aam Aadmi Party chief Arvind Kejriwal's visit. Pro-Khalistan slogans were seen written on walls near Jalandhar Shakti Peeth and Devi Talab Mandir, reports said. The police is checking CCTV footage to find out who wrote the slogans. Security has also been ramped up before Kejriwal's visit.

140.title: You will have really bad days: Opener Ruturaj Gaikwad on T20 cricket
140.article_body: India opener Ruturaj Gaikwad said a player will have "really bad" days while playing T20 cricket, adding that one needs to stay consistent mentally and trust the process. Talking about the recently concluded IPL 2022 where he scored 368 runs for CSK, Ruturaj stated, "The wicket was slightly bowler-friendly...It was two-paced, the ball was turning and there was some swing."

141.title: TRS, AAP to skip Mamata Banerjee's opposition meeting in Delhi today: Reports
141.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party and the Telangana Rashtra Samithi have decided to not attend West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee's opposition meeting in Delhi today. "Aam Aadmi Party will not participate in the meeting," Free Press Journal quoted a source as saying. "There is no question of sharing any platform with the Congress," TRS in a statement.

142.title: His innings was pure class: Finch on Maxwell's 80*(51) vs SL
142.article_body: Australia captain Aaron Finch praised all-rounder Glenn Maxwell for his performance in their two-wicket win against Sri Lanka in the first ODI. "That innings by Maxwell was pure class. Showed a lot of skill," stated Finch. Maxwell came in to bat when Australia needed 93 off 84 balls with five wickets remaining and scored unbeaten 80 runs off 51 balls.

143.title: Sister suggested I try modelling, took 2,000 auditions to get breakthrough: Jay
143.article_body: Actor Jay Bhanushali said that his sister had suggested that he should try modelling. He added that he worked on her suggestion later. "The journey is not easy...It has a number of ups and downs. It took me 2,000 auditions to get that breakthrough...Double the number of sleepless nights and hard work to get where I am today," he said.

144.title: Woman who came to Mumbai in search of job gang-raped; relative among 4 held
144.article_body: A 19-year-old married woman, who came to Mumbai in search of job, was allegedly gang-raped in Kurla area, police said on Tuesday. The victim is a resident of Kolkata and had come to Mumbai along with her relative in March, police added. The woman claimed she was gang-raped by her relative and three others following which the accused were apprehended.

145.title: Population isn't a burden for Bihar, says JD(U) MLC Neeraj Kumar
145.article_body: JD(U) MLC Neeraj Kumar on Tuesday said that the population is not a burden for Bihar. "We can't debar weaker sections like Dalits, tribals and Muslims from education and health facilities in the name of population control," Kumar added. "After Nagaland, Bihar stabilised its reproduction rate. We are half of the national average," he stated.

146.title: Ticket checker booked for urinating near woman's berth gets bail in Mumbai
146.article_body: Bombay High Court on Tuesday granted pre-arrest bail to a ticket checker booked for urinating near a passenger's berth on condition that he deposits ₹25,000 to Railways. The amount will be used to install a water cooler at Karjat railway station in Thane. He had urinated near a woman passenger's berth in an inebriated state on Hazrat Nizamuddin-Pune Duronto Express.

147.title: I've no link with beginning of COVID: Johar on reports calling his party 'super-spreader'
147.article_body: After reports called his birthday party 'super-spreader' claiming that around 50 guests were infected with COVID-19, Karan Johar said, "We don't know who contracted it and when because there was a lot happening." He added, "I've no connection with the beginning and origin of this pandemic." He stated, "There was another party...there were weddings...there were events, shoots, why blame me?"

148.title: Pharma profits prevail over global good, COVID response must include patent waiver: India
148.article_body: The measures that the World Trade Organisation is negotiating as part of the response to COVID-19 pandemic must include the patent waiver proposal of India and South Africa, said Union Minister Piyush Goyal. He added, "It is sad that the super-profits of a few pharmaceutical companies prevail over global good." He was addressing the 12th ministerial conference of the WTO.

149.title: 'Agniveers' will get priority in jobs in CAPFs, Assam Rifles: MHA
149.article_body: The 'Agniveers' who complete four years' service in the military under the 'Agnipath' scheme will be given priority in recruitment in Central Armed Police Forces (CAPFs) and Assam Rifles, said the Ministry of Home Affairs. The move will help youngsters trained under the scheme to contribute more to the service and security of the nation, added the ministry.

150.title: India opposes WTO's global deal to eliminate fisheries subsidies
150.article_body: At World Trade Organization's conference in Geneva, India opposed a global deal to eliminate fisheries subsidies. Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal said unlike other advanced fishing nations, India doesn't operate huge fishing fleets to exploit the resources indiscriminately. Goyal added that India wants to protect subsidies to poor traditional fishermen as it's a matter of livelihood for them.

151.title: If BJP is a virus, TMC is its vaccine: TMC MP Abhishek Banerjee
151.article_body: TMC MP Abhishek Banerjee on Tuesday said the "double-engine government" has failed in Tripura and TMC can give a bright future to the state. "If BJP is...virus, then TMC is its vaccine," Banerjee stated. "BJP's irresponsible...careless comments have created chaos and infighting within...country," he added. He was speaking at a rally in Tripura ahead of the Assembly bypolls.

152.title: Chinese attack would hit global trade more than Ukraine war: Taiwan
152.article_body: Taiwan's top trade negotiator John Deng said a Chinese military attack on the island would harm the global economy more than the Ukraine war. Deng noted that the world relies on Taiwan for semiconductor chips used in electric vehicles and mobile phones, hinting the implications of a Chinese attack would be sweeping for any industry that relies on the technology.

153.title: Cabinet approves auction of 5G spectrum, to be held in July
153.article_body: The Union Cabinet approved a proposal of the Department of Telecommunications to conduct spectrum auction through which spectrum will be assigned to successful bidders for providing 5G services to public and enterprises. A total of 72097.85 MHz of spectrum with a validity period of 20 years will be put to auction to be held by the end of July 2022.

154.title: We import tea on loan, reduce the amount of tea you drink: Pak minister to people
154.article_body: Amid the economic crisis, people in Pakistan have been asked to reduce the amount of tea they drink, with minister Ahsan Iqbal saying that it would cut the country's high import bills. "I appeal to the nation to cut down the consumption of tea by one to two cups because we import tea on loan," Iqbal further said.

155.title: Marcelo is more than a teammate, a brother football gave me: Cristiano
155.article_body: Cristiano Ronaldo took to Instagram to term his former Real Madrid teammate Marcelo as "more than" a teammate, adding that the Brazilian defender is a "brother" that football gave him. "One of the biggest stars with whom I had the pleasure of sharing a locker room," added Cristiano in the caption. Marcelo won a record 25 trophies at Real Madrid.

156.title: CM Bhagwant Mann launches online driving licence facility in Punjab
156.article_body: Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann launched online driving licence facility in Punjab to enable people to get a learner's driving licence from the comfort of their homes. Applicants can apply for the licence by uploading their Aadhaar cards on the portal and appear in the online test. The facility will save time, money and energy of people, CM Mann said.

157.title: Dying inside, it's time to say 'Ab khel shuru': Ranbir on 'Brahmastra' trailer
157.article_body: Actress Neetu Kapoor took to Instagram to share a video message by her son and actor Ranbir Kapoor ahead of the trailer launch of 'Brahmastra'. Ranbir, in the video, said that he is eagerly waiting for the audience's reaction to the trailer and movie. "I'm dying inside...it's the right time to say 'Ab khel shuru' [Game begins now]," he added.

158.title: England lose 0-4 against Hungary, record worst home defeat since 1928
158.article_body: England were defeated 0-4 by Hungary in a UEFA Nations League match having lost against them previously in their Nations League opener. England have been handed their worst home defeat in 94 years, with the previous loss resulting in them losing to Hungary for the first time in 60 years. "Tonight is a chastening experience," said England manager Gareth Southgate.

159.title: Expensive digital pics of monkeys are going to improve the world, jokes Gates on NFTs
159.article_body: Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates took a dig at cryptocurrency projects such as NFTs, calling them "shams based on the greater-fool theory". On being asked about what he thinks of Bored Apes, Gates sarcastically said, "Obviously, expensive digital images of monkeys are going to improve the world immensely." He further stated that he's neither long nor short the asset class.

160.title: 'I seek forgiveness for this' says Kiran Bedi over video of her joke on Sikhs
160.article_body: BJP leader Kiran Bedi has apologised over a video of her making a joke on Sikhs at a book launch event on Monday. Bedi tweeted, "What I said to the audience even at my own cost (as I also belong here) be kindly not misread. I seek forgiveness for this." She added, "I'm the last person to cause any hurt."

161.title: It wasn't our best effort, India were the better side: Bavuma after defeat
161.article_body: South Africa captain Temba Bavuma said Team India were the better side in their third T20I on Tuesday. "As a collective, it wasn't our best effort...With the ball, they put us under pressure...With the batting, we didn't really turn up," he stated. India posted 179/5 and then restricted South Africa to 131 to win the game by 48 runs.

162.title: PM expert in making news, not in creating jobs: Rahul Gandhi
162.article_body: Following PMO’s announcement to recruit 10 lakh people in 1.5 years, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday said that PM Narendra Modi is an "expert" in making news. "This is not a government of 'jumlas’, it is a government of ‘maha jumlas’. The Prime Minister is not an expert in creating jobs, but in making ‘news’ on jobs," Gandhi tweeted.

163.title: 17 Hindu refugees from Pakistan get Indian citizenship in Gujarat
163.article_body: As many as 17 Hindu refugees from Pakistan were granted Indian citizenship by Ahmedabad Collector Sandip Sagale. The refugees reportedly thanked the Ahmedabad district administration for showing expediency in granting them citizenship. As per Citizenship Act, foreign nationals living in India for seven or more years get citizenship after following due constitutional procedure.

164.title: Why is WHO working on changing the name of monkeypox virus?
164.article_body: The World Health Organization has said it is working with experts to come up with a new name for monkeypox. It comes after over 30 scientists wrote last week about the "urgent need for a non-discriminatory and non-stigmatising" name for the virus. The current name does not adhere to WHO guidelines that discourage the use of geographic regions or animals.

165.title: Russia tells Ukrainian forces in Sievierodonetsk to lay down arms
165.article_body: Ukrainian fighters holed up in Azot chemical plant in Sievierodonetsk should stop their senseless resistance and lay down arms, said Russia's National Defence Management Centre chief Mikhail Mizintsev. The stranded civilians would be allowed to pass through a humanitarian corridor, he added. According to Ukraine, over 500 civilians are trapped with soldiers inside the plant.

166.title: Ukraine needs more heavy weapons: NATO as Russia intensifies attacks
166.article_body: NATO Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg said the West needs to send "more heavy weapons" to Ukraine as Russia intensifies attacks in eastern Ukraine. Stoltenberg added that NATO was already "stepping up" deliveries and officials would be meeting in Brussels on Wednesday to coordinate further support. Ukraine's Defence Ministry on Tuesday said Kyiv had received just 10% of the weapons it requested.

167.title: Punjab Police gets 7-day remand of Lawrence Bishnoi in Moosewala murder case
167.article_body: A Punjab court has remanded gangster Lawrence Bishnoi to seven-day police custody in Sidhu Moosewala murder case. Bishnoi was brought to Mansa on Wednesday and was produced in court after being medically examined. Reports said that Bishnoi is being taken to Mohali by Punjab Police. Police had earlier said that Bishnoi was the mastermind in Moosewala murder case.

168.title: Lucky Singh from 'Lage Raho...' is a rascal, Virus an unhappy man: Boman
168.article_body: Talking about his character Viru Sahastrabudhhe also known as Virus in the film '3 Idiots', actor Boman Irani said he is such an "unhappy" man. "I am...surprised that people...like an unhappy character like Virus because he is so negative," Boman had earlier stated. Boman said his character of Lucky Singh in Sanjay Dutt-starrer 'Lage Raho Munna Bhai' was a "rascal".

169.title: Hope you're at peace: Preity Zinta on Sushant's death anniversary
169.article_body: Actress Preity Zinta, taking to Instagram, shared a picture with late actor Sushant Singh Rajput on his second death anniversary. Along with the picture, Preity wrote, "Hope you are at peace wherever you are #GoneTooSoon." Earlier, actress Rhea Chakraborty took to Instagram and shared pictures with the late actor. "Miss you every day," Rhea captioned the post.

170.title: Pant did many things right in 3rd T20I vs SA, result is evident: Parthiv Patel
170.article_body: Former wicketkeeper-batter Parthiv Patel has said Rishabh Pant "did many things right" in his captaincy in the third T20I against South Africa, which India won by 48 runs. "Pant's bowling changes were much better. Whenever it seemed like South Africa were building a partnership, Chahal was brought into the attack," added Parthiv. Chahal registered figures of 3/20 in the game.

171.title: Over 130 hospitalised after gas leak in chemical factory in Iran
171.article_body: More than 130 people were reportedly hospitalised after a nitrogen gas leak occurred in a chemical factory in Iran on Tuesday. The affected people were later released from the hospital, said officials. "The injured mostly suffered from respiratory problems caused by nitrogen gas, which is not dangerous," said an official. The fire caused by the leak was extinguished.

172.title: Ex-Myntra CEO's Mensa Brands acquires smart wearables brand Pebble
172.article_body: Former Myntra CEO and Medlife Co-founder Ananth Narayanan's Mensa Brands has acquired Noida-based smart wearable brand Pebble for an undisclosed sum. Founded in 2013 by father-daughter duo, Ajay Agarwal and Komal Agarwal, Pebble offers audio products, fitness wearables, and charging solutions. Earlier in January, Mensa Brands had acquired the majority stake in personal care brand Florona.

173.title: Outrageous act of political vendetta: Stalin on ED's questioning of Rahul
173.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin condemned the questioning of Congress’ Rahul Gandhi by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) and called it an "outrageous act of political vendetta" against Congress and its leaders. "BJP uses such diversionary tactics to save itself from the public ire," Stalin tweeted. "Political opponents should be fought politically, not by 'forcing' the ED," he added.

174.title: Kejriwal, Sisodia will lose memory: Mishra on Satyendar's memory loss claim
174.article_body: While reacting to Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain's claim of losing memory due to COVID-19 during questioning in an alleged money laundering case, BJP leader Kapil Mishra said, "If the matter of [him losing] memory is true, then Satyendar Jain is automatically ineligible to become minister...Now the memory of Sisodia and Kejriwal will also go away," Mishra wrote on Twitter.
