175.title: Light rainfall likely in Delhi today, temp to drop over next 5 days: IMD
175.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted light rainfall with the possibility of thunder and lightning in Delhi today. The minimum temperature is likely to be around 31°C, while the maximum temperature is expected to reach 40°C. IMD has also issued a yellow alert in the national capital for next five days till June 20 in view of the thunderstorms.

176.title: Media’s role is to bring society & govt’s shortcomings to fore: PM Modi
176.article_body: The role of media is to bring to fore shortcomings in society and government and also highlight positive news, PM Narendra Modi said on Tuesday. “As much as the media has right to criticise, it has the same responsibility to bring positive news to fore,” he added. PM Modi addressed an event to commemorate 200 years of Mumbai Samachar newspaper.

177.title: Man seeking MBBS admission for daughter cheated of ₹8 lakh in Pune
177.article_body: Pune Police have booked a woman lawyer for allegedly cheating a man of ₹8 lakh by promising to get his daughter enrolled in DY Patil college, Nerul, for the MBBS course. As per police complaint, the accused pretended that she'd good relations with the owner of the college, Satej Patil. The complainant met accused at a function in September 2021.

178.title: India reports 8,822 new COVID-19 cases, highest in 3 months
178.article_body: India on Wednesday reported a new high in three months in the daily COVID-19 tally with 8,822 new cases in the last 24 hours, taking the overall count to 4,32,45,517. According to the Health Ministry data, a total of 15 deaths have been reported in the last 24 hours, taking the total fatalities due to the virus to 5,24,792.

179.title: Amit Mishra's ‘Can fly low-on-fuel plane with faulty engine' tweet on Hardik goes viral
179.article_body: Veteran leg-spinner Amit Mishra's tweet describing Hardik Pandya's knock of 31*(21) in third T20I against South Africa went viral. Referring to Hardik being dropped for 1 and edging a few deliveries, Mishra wrote, "Hardik...is so lucky...that he can fly a low-on-fuel plane, with a faulty engine, in a thunderstorm and yet can land it safely to the destination."

180.title: Video shows Olympic gold medallist Neeraj Chopra's national record-breaking throw
180.article_body: The Sports Authority of India has shared a video of India's Olympic gold-medal winning javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra's national record-breaking throw at the Paavo Nurmi Games in Finland. The 24-year-old bettered his own national record with a best throw of 89.30 metres. He clinched silver medal at the tournament, just 0.53 metres behind the winner.

181.title: TV actors have never really been welcomed in B'wood: Urvashi Dholakia
181.article_body: TV actress Urvashi Dholakia has said, "Television actors have never really been welcomed in Bollywood, if I may say so." However, she added, "Things might've changed now and actors are being looked upon differently today." Urvashi stated she was happy working in television and she had everything she wanted at that time. "I became popular overnight...across the globe," she stated.

182.title: China lifts COVID-19 visa ban on Indians after 2 years
182.article_body: China has announced plans to provide visas to Indian professionals and their families stranded in India for over two years. On Monday, Chinese Embassy in India updated its COVID-19 visa policy after over two years. China is also processing requests of thousands of Indian students studying in Chinese institutions who have conveyed their interest to re-join their colleges and universities.

183.title: Strawberry Moon lights up the sky across the world, pics surface
183.article_body: This year's Strawberry Moon was seen in the night sky across the world on Tuesday night. The Strawberry Moon was closer to the Earth and larger than an average full Moon this year, the NASA said. The Strawberry Moon gained its name from the strawberry harvesting season in northeastern North America.

184.title: 10-year-old boy rescued from borewell in Chhattisgarh after 106 hours, rushed to ICU
184.article_body: Rahul Sahu, a 10-year-old boy who had fallen into a 60-feet-deep borewell in Chhattisgarh's Janjgir Champa district, was rescued after a 106-hour-long operation on Tuesday night, officials said. He was then rushed to Apollo Hospital in Bilaspur on a green corridor. "He is currently kept in the ICU under the supervision of a team of specialist doctors," tweeted CMO Chhattisgarh.

185.title: No census this year, deadline to freeze administrative boundaries extended
185.article_body: The Registrar General of India (RGI) on Tuesday sent a letter to all states and Union Territories informing that the deadline to freeze administrative boundaries has been extended to December 31, 2022. This has ruled out the possibility of a census this year. The census, originally scheduled for 2021, could be pushed to 2023-24 after the administrative boundaries are frozen.

186.title: Rahul and Priyanka meet Sonia Gandhi at Sir Ganga Ram Hospital in Delhi
186.article_body: Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi Vadra met their mother and Congress leader Sonia Gandhi at Sir Ganga Ram Hospital in Delhi on Tuesday. Sonia has been admitted to hospital due to COVID-19 related issues. She had tested positive for COVID-19 on June 2 and sought more time from ED to appear for questioning in a money laundering case.

187.title: World's 5th richest man Warren Buffett donates $4 billion to charity
187.article_body: As part of his pledge to give away nearly all of his net worth, Warren Buffett donated about $4 billion to Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation Trust and four family charities. Since 2006, the world's 5th richest man has donated more than half of his Berkshire shares, with the donations worth about $45.5 billion at the time they were made.

188.title: I changed my seam position: Yuzvendra Chahal on 3/20 vs SA
188.article_body: Team India spinner Yuzvendra Chahal, who was named Player of the Match for registering figures of 3/20 in the third T20I against South Africa, said he changed his seam position and focused on his strengths in the game. "I didn't bowl well in the previous games, the coach asked me to back my strengths...I focused on that," he stated.

189.title: Terrorist who shot bank manager in Kulgam, killed in encounter
189.article_body: One out of the two Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) terrorists, who were killed on Wednesday in an encounter in Jammu and Kashmir's Shopian, was involved in the killing of Vijay Kumar, a bank manager from Kulgam, Kashmir Zone Police tweeted. He has been identified as Jan Mohd Lone, police added. The Jammu and Kashmir Police and security forces conducted the operation jointly.

190.title: SRK, Salman danced to 'Bhangda...': Karan Johar on his 50th b'day
190.article_body: Karan Johar said Shah Rukh Khan and Salman Khan danced to the song 'Bhangda Paale' from their film 'Karan Arjun' at his 50th birthday party. "Ranveer Singh was the incharge of...music...The party was...at 10-11 pm...but he came to Yash Raj Studio at 4 just to...check [the sound]," added Karan. "It was like every star hitting the dance floor," he stated.

191.title: Warner Bros Discovery may cut 1,000 global ad sales jobs: Report
191.article_body: Warner Bros Discovery is looking to cut up to 30% or nearly 1,000 jobs in its global advertising sales team, Reuters reported citing a source. It has offered members of its US advertising sales team an opportunity to voluntarily leave the company. The firm has a goal of achieving $3 billion in cost savings.

192.title: Ranbir said 'Please don't call me, I get tensed': Karan on 'Koffee With Karan'
192.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar said that actor Ranbir Kapoor has asked him to not call him on the new season of 'Koffee With Karan'. "He has told me 'I'm not coming on the show...you have to pay the price for it for too long, why should I do this to myself?'...He said 'I feel tensed'," Karan added.

193.title: 2 men posing as customers steal gold jewellery worth ₹20 lakh in Noida
193.article_body: Two men posing as customers at a jewellery shop at Atta Market in Noida's Sector-27 fled with gold jewellery worth ₹20 lakh. The incident occurred on Tuesday when the accused asked for some gold jewellery, police said. One of them sneaked the jewellery inside his clothes and left the shop while the other engaged the owner in conversation, police added.

194.title: 31 students of 2 schools in Bengaluru test positive for COVID-19
194.article_body: Thirty-one students from two schools in Bengaluru's Dasarahalli tested positive for COVID-19. The students were tested when a Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) team went to the schools on June 9 to vaccinate the children against COVID-19 and found some of them showing symptoms. The schools have been sanitised and BBMP has directed them to follow COVID-19 protocols.

195.title: Satyendar Jain said he lost memory after COVID-19 when faced with hawala documents: ED
195.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate told a court that Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain said he was suffering from memory loss due to COVID-19 when he was confronted with documents in connection with alleged hawala transactions. The ED also claimed that despite showing him documents, where he had signed in the capacity of the President, Jain completely disassociated himself from a trust.

196.title: Execution was spot-on from bowlers, batters: Pant on 48-run win vs SA
196.article_body: Team India stand-in captain Rishabh Pant said the execution was spot-on as they won by 48 runs in the third T20I against South Africa on Tuesday. "Bowlers did a fantastic job for us. In India, spinners play a big role...[and] when they come off nicely then matches like this happen," he added. Chahal registered figures of 3/20 in the game.

197.title: 3 students, including minor, feared drowned at Mumbai's Juhu beach
197.article_body: Three of a group of four students, including a 16-year-old boy, were feared drowned at Mumbai's Juhu beach on Tuesday afternoon. All four, residents of Vashi Naka in Chembur, had arrived at the beach together and were pulled in by the waves. Though Abhishek managed to swim ashore with help from a lifeguard, his three friends are feared drowned.

198.title: Admissions closing soon for IIM-I & Jigsaw's Product Management program
198.article_body: Admissions are closing soon for the 7th batch of Jigsaw's Product Management program designed, delivered & certified by IIM Indore. The program features 5i Framework-based curriculum, Harvard Business case studies and BYOP feature. As per Glassdoor, the average salary for Product Managers in India is ₹15 lakh. Now is the right time to upskill in this domain, Jigsaw said.

199.title: Daughter made my profile on dating site, insisted I go on dates: Suchitra
199.article_body: Actress Suchitra Krishnamoorthi, who acted in Shah Rukh Khan-starrer 'Kabhi Haan Kabhi Naa', said her daughter Kaveri created a profile for her on a dating site being a single parent after her divorce with director Shekhar Kapur. "She insisted...I go on...dates," added Suchitra. Discussing her relationships, she stated, "Post my divorce I had one relationship...Thankfully nobody knows about it."

200.title: Reports of being cut from 'Aquaman 2' slightly insane: Amber Heard
200.article_body: Amber Heard has responded to reports of being entirely cut from 'Aquaman 2'. As per the People magazine, the actress' spokesperson said, "The rumour mill continues as it has from day one...inaccurate, insensitive...slightly insane." Amber portrays the role of Mera in the film and during Johnny Depp's defamation trial, she said she fought hard to stay in the film.

201.title: Work with greater dedication for victory: CM Jairam tells party workers
201.article_body: Himachal Pradesh Chief Minister Jairam Thakur urged BJP party workers to work with greater dedication and commitment to ensure BJP was re-elected in the upcoming assembly elections so that the pace of development in the state is uninterrupted. "Only in BJP...a common worker rises to the topmost position, while all other political outfits are headed by families," he said.

202.title: Ganguly tags wrong Chhetri in tweet, he says 'Hi Sourav, this is Sunil from Nepal'
202.article_body: BCCI President Sourav Ganguly tagged the wrong Sunil Chhetri in his tweet congratulating the Indian men's football team captain and the team on qualifying for the AFC Asian Cup. The person Ganguly tagged in his post responded, saying, "Hi Sourav, this is Sunil from Nepal, not your captain Sunil Chhetri. Please correct your mention for your captain."

203.title: I've 30 days to pick up my entire life & leave Singapore: Coinbase manager after lay-off
203.article_body: After being laid off, Coinbase APAC Recruitment Manager Clinton Gleave wrote on LinkedIn, "After building our entire APAC expansion from scratch...even overperforming...I've been laid off." He added, "I've 30 days to pick up my entire life & leave Singapore...I know CEO [Brian Armstrong] didn't make this decision lightly...& have nothing but respect for [him]...but that doesn't change the impact."

204.title: 12 -year-old boy crushed under rear wheels of school bus, dies in Pune
204.article_body: A 12 -year-old boy was crushed to death by a school bus in Pune. Reports said that the school bus was dropping students back home when the incident took place. Police said that the bus took a turn, after which, the boy was crushed under the rear wheels of the vehicle. The 49-year-old driver of the bus has been booked.

205.title: Internet Explorer shut down from today after 27 years
205.article_body: Microsoft today officially shut down its web browser, Internet Explorer, 27 years after it made its debut. Starting today, those who try to open the application will be directed to the company's more recent browser Microsoft Edge. Internet Explorer was launched in 1995 as an add-on package for Windows 95.

206.title: Won't tolerate forced conversions, will tweak law if needed: Goa CM
206.article_body: Goa Chief Minister Pramod Sawant on Tuesday said that illegal religious conversions by inducement or duress will not be tolerated and that the anti-conversion law may be modified to check it. "At present, the law is weak. My legal team is studying it. If any changes are required, they will be carried out," Sawant said.

207.title: Actor Karanvir, 5 others cheated me of ₹1.99 crore; he threatened to shoot me: Woman
207.article_body: A case has been registered against six people including actor Karanvir Bohra for allegedly cheating a 40-year-old woman of ₹1.99 crore after promising to return it at 2.5% interest, police said. The woman claimed that when she asked for the amount, Bohra and his wife Tajinder Sidhu did not respond properly and threatened to shoot her, police added.

208.title: Authorities step up measures to deal with rising COVID-19 cases in Delhi
208.article_body: Authorities have ramped up measures to tackle the current spike in COVID-19 cases in Delhi. Deploying more people for monitoring home isolation cases, restocking medicines and aggressive contact tracing are some of the measures being undertaken. Ensure genome sequencing of COVID-19 cases to detect emergence of new variants, Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena had directed officials on Monday.

209.title: Excited about 1st day of school, 4-yr-old falls off terrace in Thane
209.article_body: A 4-year-old died after allegedly falling off the fifth-floor terrace at Geeta Apartment in Thane West's Panch Pakhadi area. The deceased was to attend school for the first time on Tuesday, his family told the police. The family believes that he must've tried to look down when he lost his balance and fell.

210.title: India defeat Hong Kong 4-0, qualify for 2023 AFC Asian Cup as group winners
210.article_body: India defeated Hong Kong 4-0 on Tuesday to qualify for the 2023 AFC Asian Cup as group winners. India finished first in Group D in the third round of 2023 AFC Asian Cup qualifiers with nine points. The Indian men's football team have booked their place in back-to-back AFC Asian Cup editions for the first time.

211.title: Olympic gold medal-winning javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra breaks his own national record
211.article_body: India's Olympic gold medal-winning javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra on Tuesday broke his own national record at the Paavo Nurmi Games in Finland. The 24-year-old bagged silver medal in the event with a best throw of 89.30 metres. He had set the previous national record with an 88.07-metre throw in March 2021.

212.title: BTS band members break down while announcing indefinite break
212.article_body: South Korean boy band BTS' members RM, Jin, Suga, J-Hope, Jimin, V and Jungkook on Tuesday announced they are taking an indefinite hiatus to focus on solo pursuits. They shared this during their streamed annual Festa dinner, part of a celebration that marks their anniversary as a group. Several of the members broke down while talking about taking time off.

213.title: Jury heard testimony from paid employees and randos: Amber on Depp's witnesses
213.article_body: In her first interview since she lost the defamation trial to Johnny Depp, Amber Heard said the trial wasn't fair. When asked about the jury, she said, "How could they make a judgment?...They...sat in those seats and heard...testimony from paid employees and towards the end of the trial, randos." However, she insisted that she did not blame the jury.

214.title: Those who say cinema is dead aren't looking in right places: H'wood writer on RRR
214.article_body: Hollywood writer Larry Karaszewski, known for writing postmodern biopics, praised filmmaker SS Rajamouli's film 'RRR'. Taking to Twitter, Larry tweeted, "Those who say cinema is dead aren't looking in the right places. #RRR." RRR's official Twitter handle commented on Larry's tweet and wrote, "Thanks for your kind words. Hope you enjoyed the film as well, sir."

215.title: Mom gave up on her dream to become an actor because of me: Sikandar on Kirron
215.article_body: Actor Sikandar Kher said that his mother, Kirron Kher had come to Mumbai to become an actor but since he was very young at the time, she focused on raising him. "She gave up on that dream so that she could look after me, missing out on her prime years," he added. "That extent of selflessness is rare," Sikandar said.

216.title: Canada & Denmark divide island, end 50-yr-long ownership dispute
216.article_body: Canada and Denmark have decided to divide a small, uninhabited island in the Arctic called the 'Hans Island', ending a 50-year-long ownership dispute between the countries. The island, with an area of 1.2 square kilometres, is equidistant from both Canada's Ellesmere Island and Denmark's Greenland. Both countries had laid claim to the island since 1971.

217.title: An innings of a lifetime: Sehwag on Bairstow's 136(92) in 2nd Test vs NZ
217.article_body: Virender Sehwag took to Twitter to praise batter Jonny Bairstow following his 92-ball 136 in England's five-wicket win against New Zealand in second Test at Trent Bridge. "Bairstow, an innings of a lifetime, one of the best counter-attacking fourth innings you'll ever see. Well done England, Test cricket is best cricket," he wrote. England lead the three-match Test series 2-0.

218.title: Every year 2 crore jobs announced by Modi govt: Sitaram Yechury
218.article_body: CPI(M) General Secretary Sitaram Yechury criticised PM Narendra Modi's instruction to recruit 10 lakh people in the next 18 months and said that every year two crore jobs had been announced by the Modi government. "How many times have you heard such a thing in the last 8-10 years?" Yechury said. He called the move "gross injustice to the youth".

219.title: Attempt to fool the masses: TMC on PM's recruitment announcement
219.article_body: TMC criticised Prime Minister Narendra Modi's instruction to recruit 10 lakh people in the next 18 months, calling it an attempt to "fool the masses" before 2024 polls. "None of the promises made by BJP and PM Narendra Modi has ever been fulfilled," TMC's Partha Chatterjee said. BJP comes up with a new trick every time election approaches, he added.

220.title: Jailed Kremlin critic Alexey Navalny moved to undisclosed location
220.article_body: Jailed Russian opposition leader Alexey Navalny has been shifted to an undisclosed location, his close aide has confirmed. Navalny, who is serving an 11.5-year-long jail sentence for alleged fraud at a penal colony near Moscow, was reportedly transferred without receiving prior notice. Navalny was poisoned by what the West said was a nerve agent in 2020.

221.title: Jonny Bairstow smashes the second-fastest Test hundred by an England cricketer
221.article_body: Jonny Bairstow on Tuesday smashed the second-fastest Test hundred by an England cricketer after reaching the three-figure mark off 77 deliveries in his team's second innings in the second Test against New Zealand. Bairstow went on to score 136 runs off 92 deliveries. England chased down a 299-run target on the last day of the Test in just 50 overs.

222.title: Tesla India policy executive quits after company puts India plan on hold: Report
222.article_body: Tesla's Policy and Business Development executive for India and new markets in South East Asia, Manuj Khurana, has resigned weeks after the carmaker put on hold its plans to sell electric cars in the country, Reuters reported. Khurana was appointed to the role in March 2021 and was lobbying the Indian government to slash the import tax on electric cars.

223.title: WHO to hold emergency meet next week to determine if monkeypox is an emergency
223.article_body: WHO said it would hold an emergency meeting on June 23 to determine whether to classify the global monkeypox outbreak as a public health emergency of international concern. "The global outbreak of monkeypox is unusual and concerning," said WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus. "We believe it needs...some coordinated response because of the geographic spread," he told reporters.

224.title: The lows have taught me a lot, made me a stronger person: Saiyami Kher
224.article_body: Actress Saiyami Kher said her career has been a roller coaster ride with lots of ups and downs. "The downs have taught me...and made me a stronger person and actor. The highs make it all worth the wait," she added. "My attempt has...been to play a new character and try portraying the most honest version of that life," she added.

225.title: Afghanistan complete 3-0 T20I series whitewash against Zimbabwe
225.article_body: Afghanistan completed a 3-0 whitewash against Zimbabwe in the T20I series after a 35-run win in the third and final T20I in Harare. Afghanistan's 17-year-old spinner Noor Ahmad, who posted bowling figures of 4-0-10-4 on his international debut, was adjudged 'Player of the Match'. Afghanistan scored 125/8 in 20 overs and restricted Zimbabwe at 90/9 in 20 overs.

226.title: Demolitions attributable to a state policy which is illegal: Ex-judges to SC
226.article_body: Several retired judges and senior advocates have filed a petition in the Supreme Court, claiming that the demolitions of violence accused's houses in UP is "attributable to a state policy which is illegal". The petition urged SC to take immediate suo motu action. UP CM Yogi Adityanath's remarks emboldened police to "brutally, and unlawfully, torture protestors", the petition further said.

227.title: Tomb with 'Do not open' warning in blood-red text discovered in Israel
227.article_body: A tomb with a warning written in blood-red text, which warns against opening it, has been discovered in Israel. It was found by archaeologists in a recently discovered cave within an old cemetery in the Galilee. Israel's official Twitter account shared the photos and wrote, "An 1,800 year old grave marker for a Jewish man named Jacob the Convert."

228.title: Police take down posters of Ranchi violence accused across city citing 'error'
228.article_body: Hours after putting up posters across the city of the persons accused in the recent violent protests in Jharkhand's Ranchi, police removed them citing "some error" in the posters. "They are removed, but will be put up again after correction," Ranchi Police added in a statement. So far, police have arrested six persons in connection with the violence.

229.title: SP expels MLA Rajesh Kumar Shukla for crossing over to BJP in MP
229.article_body: The Samajwadi Party said it has expelled MLA Rajesh Kumar Shukla from the party's primary membership for "anti-party activities" and for switching over to BJP in Madhya Pradesh. "We are also trying to ensure that his Assembly membership gets terminated," SP's Madhya Pradesh unit president Ramayan Patel said. Shukla, along with two other legislators, joined BJP in Bhopal on Tuesday.

230.title: India record their biggest T20I victory against South Africa, stay alive in the series
230.article_body: India defeated South Africa by 48 runs in the third T20I in Visakhapatnam to stay alive in the five-match series after having lost the first two T20Is. The victory is India's biggest (by runs) against South Africa in T20Is. India's previous biggest T20I victory against South Africa had come on September 20, 2007, when they won by 37 runs.

231.title: Mobile phones will be confiscated if found in schools: TN Minister
231.article_body: Tamil Nadu School Education Minister Anbil Mahesh Poyyamozhi on Tuesday warned students against carrying mobile phones to classes and said that they would be confiscated if found in schools. "The young minds should be refreshed through education curriculum," he said. The minister's message comes a day after the schools for classes 1 to 10 re-opened on Monday.

232.title: Gambhir has the best cricketing brain in LSG squad: Jasmer Dhankhar
232.article_body: Jasmer Dhankhar, who served as a reserve player at LSG camp in IPL 2022 season, said mentor Gautam Gambhir had the "best cricketing brain" in the team's squad. "I liked how he thinks in a very distinct way," he added. "He is a very honest and upbeat individual. Every squad needs someone with his characteristics," Dhankhar further said.

233.title: I asked Bhuvneshwar if he had any goals in IPL, 'purple cap' he said: Steyn
233.article_body: SRH bowling coach Dale Steyn disclosed a conversation that took place between him and pacer Bhuvneshwar Kumar during the IPL 2022 season. "I asked him [Bhuvneshwar] if he had got any goals for the IPL and he secretly said to me, 'I would like to win the purple cap again'," said Steyn. Bhuvneshwar took 12 wickets in 14 matches.

234.title: Time for Opposition parties to come together on 1 platform: Baghel
234.article_body: Congress leader and Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Tuesday said that the time has come for the Opposition parties to consider coming together on a single platform. He said that the leaders of different political parties are being harassed by using ED, Income Tax Department or CBI against them. BJP is making all efforts to suppress the Opposition, he added.

235.title: Rescue op for Chhattisgarh boy stuck in borewell continues for 100 hrs
235.article_body: A rescue operation to save an 11-year-old boy who fell into an 80-feet-deep borewell in Chhattisgarh's Janjgir-Champa district completed 100 hours on Tuesday. The child was breathing but not showing any movement, as per people involved in the rescue work. A green corridor has been created to shift the boy to a hospital in Bilaspur after he is rescued.

236.title: 7 people injured in a bear attack in MP's Shivpuri
236.article_body: Seven persons, including a 70-year-old man, were injured when a bear attacked them while fetching water in Madhya Pradesh's Shivpuri, a forest department official said. The bear entered Gajigarh, a tribal-dominated village, in search of water. On finding a water tank, where a number of locals were standing to collect water, it attacked them from behind, the official said.

237.title: Unnecessary & oppressive: TS Singh Deo on ED summon to Rahul Gandhi
237.article_body: Chhattisgarh Health Minister TS Singh Deo criticised ED summon to Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, calling it "unnecessary and oppressive". "It doesn't seem they have a question they want to ask. If they had, they would've asked directly [that] wouldn't have taken over 1-2 hours," Deo said. Rahul Gandhi was summoned by the ED in the National Herald money laundering case.

238.title: PM's security asks Aaditya to get off father Uddhav's car over no name on VIP list: Report
238.article_body: PM Narendra Modi's security on Tuesday asked Maharashtra Minister Aaditya Thackeray to get off CM Uddhav Thackeray's car as his name wasn't on the list of VIPs scheduled to receive the PM in Mumbai, according to reports. Uddhav reportedly told the security that Aaditya wasn't merely his son but also a minister. Aaditya was later allowed to travel with him.

239.title: Giving UniCredit's Russian arm away for free would be immoral: CEO
239.article_body: UniCredit CEO Andrea Orcel on Tuesday said giving up the bank's Russian arm for free wouldn't be "morally correct". "We would be gifting something worth €3 billion for nothing to someone who is probably in a leadership that we have decided to veto," Orcel said. UniCredit's abrupt departure from Russia would hurt its 4,000 local staff and customers, he added.

240.title: Rahul questioned for over 8 hrs by ED for 2nd consecutive day; summoned again: Report
240.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has been summoned by the Enforcement Directorate to appear before it on Wednesday, after questioning him for over eight hours in connection with National Herald case on Tuesday, according to reports. This comes after he was questioned for around 10 hours on Monday after he appeared before the agency at 11:30 am.

241.title: 6 dead, 14 injured as vehicle hit by tanker overturns, falls into ditch in UP
241.article_body: Six persons died and 14 others were injured when their tractor-trolley overturned and fell into a ditch after being hit by a tanker on Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly-Agra road on Tuesday, police said. The deceased had gone to take a dip in river Ganga in the tractor-trolley. Police added that the tanker hit the vehicle in an attempt to overtake it.

242.title: Felt my brand was over after being diagnosed with cancer: Sonali Bendre
242.article_body: Sonali Bendre revealed that she felt that her "brand" was over after she was diagnosed with cancer. "We are in a visual industry, it is about the looks...you need a face that [has]...got certain sort of pleasantness for the camera," she said. The actress added that her son was a driving factor that helped her battle cancer.

243.title: Shah Rukh Khan to play scientist in Ranbir, Alia starrer Brahmastra: Reports
243.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan will reportedly play a scientist in Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt-starrer 'Brahmastra'. According to reports, his role is quite important for the film's story graph and is at least of around 15-20 minutes. Reports added that Shah Rukh completed shooting his part a few months ago and is looking forward to the film's release.

244.title: Cong's Surjewala, other party leaders continue to be in police detention
244.article_body: Congress spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala, AICC Secretary Pranav Jha and NSUI chief Neeraj Kundan along with other party leaders continue to be detained after protesting against ED summons to Rahul Gandhi in Delhi on Tuesday. Sharing a picture on social media, Surjewala said Congress leaders were detained in various police stations for over 10 hours. "What's our crime?" he wrote.

245.title: SBI hikes lending rate by 0.2%, EMIs to go up
245.article_body: India's biggest lender State Bank of India (SBI) has hiked the marginal cost of funds-based lending rate (MCLR) by 20 basis points, or 0.2%, across all loan tenors. Since consumer loans like home loans and car loans are linked with MCLR, EMIs will go up with the increase in lending rate. The new rates come into effect from June 15.

246.title: Tesla India policy head quits after firm halts India launch: Report
246.article_body: Tesla's India Policy and Business Development head Manuj Khurana has resigned, weeks after the company halted its plans to sell EVs in India, Reuters reported. Khurana had played a key role in forming a domestic market-entry plan for Tesla. The company's plan to launch in India was halted after the Centre insisted Tesla to first commit to manufacturing cars locally.

247.title: Indian woman cheats man on matrimony site in Singapore, jailed
247.article_body: A 51-year-old Indian-origin woman has been sentenced to seven months in prison in Singapore for allegedly cheating a man with a fake matrimony profile. The accused, Maliha Ramu, allegedly pretended to be a 25-year-old single woman on a matrimony website and cheated the victim of over SGD 5,000 (₹2.8 lakh). Maliha had reportedly used her relative's photos on the website.

248.title: Trent Boult creates world record, scores most runs at no. 11 in Test cricket history
248.article_body: New Zealand pacer Trent Boult broke the world record for scoring the most runs batting at number 11 in Test cricket. With his 17(15) in New Zealand's second innings in the second Test against England, he took his tally of runs at number 11 to 640. He overtook ex-Sri Lanka off-spinner Muttiah Muralitharan, who scored 623 runs at the position.

249.title: Indian businessman distributes ₹5 lakh to locals in Sri Lanka; gets caught
249.article_body: An Indian businessman named Ravinder Reddy was detained for questioning by Sri Lanka police recently after he was caught distributing ₹5 lakh to Sri Lankans. Reddy said he visited Sri Lanka every month and has been giving food and money to locals to help them during economic crisis. "The CID people took picture[s] of me, [then] caught me," he added.

250.title: Foxconn's Bharat FIH gets SEBI's nod to raise ₹5,000 crore via IPO
250.article_body: Bharat FIH, the Indian arm of iPhone maker Foxconn, has received market regulator SEBI's approval for raising ₹5,000 crore through an IPO. The public issue comprises fresh issue of shares worth ₹2,502 crore and an offer-for-sale of up to ₹2,502 crore. Bharat FIH has reserved 75% shares for qualified institutional buyers and 15% shares for non-institutional investors.

251.title: Power demand crosses 12,000 MW in Punjab on 1st day of paddy sowing
251.article_body: The power demand in Punjab crossed 12,000 MW on the first day of paddy sowing by the conventional puddling method. Punjab Power Minister Harbhajan Singh, on Tuesday, claimed that an eight-hour power supply was ensured to areas that started the transplantation. In the first phase, Hoshiarpur, Jalandhar, Nawanshahr, Kapurthala, Pathankot, Gurdaspur, Amritsar and Rupnagar started the paddy sowing.

252.title: BJP is scared of me, I dare CBI, ED to touch me: Abhishek Banerjee
252.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's nephew and TMC MP Abhishek Banerjee on Tuesday said the BJP is scared of him and further dared the CBI and ED to touch him "if they've the guts". His remarks came after CBI officers reached his residence to question his wife in connection with a coal smuggling case. TMC will reinstall democracy, he added.

253.title: 25-yr-old arrested from UP for objectionable post on Prophet
253.article_body: A 25-year-old man from UP's Ballia was arrested for allegedly uploading an objectionable post on Prophet Muhammad on social media, a police officer said on Tuesday. The matter came to light after two persons tweeted to the Ballia Police with a screenshot of the offensive post and urged the police to take action, said Rasra Circle Officer Shiv Narain Vaish.

254.title: Rafael Nadal begins training on grass after foot treatment: Report
254.article_body: Rafael Nadal has begun training on grass behind closed doors in Mallorca, according to a Spanish newspaper. The 36-year-old, who won a record-extending 22nd Grand Slam at 2022 French Open, is yet to decide whether or not he'll play at Wimbledon following his latest treatment for his chronic foot problem. Nadal hasn't competed in the grass season since 2019 Wimbledon.

255.title: Media house shares pic of Virat-Anushka's daughter, actress says 'Learn from others'
255.article_body: Anushka Sharma criticised a media house after it recently posted a picture of her daughter Vamika on Instagram. "Seems like Times Group knows what's better for kids than their parents themselves as they can't stop...posting photos despite being requested repeatedly. Learn something from other media houses and paparazzi," she commented. The post was later deleted by the media house.

256.title: Russia destroys last bridge in Ukrainian city, civilians trapped
256.article_body: Russia has eliminated the last bridge connecting Ukraine's Sievierodonetsk to the other parts of the country amid the ongoing war, a Ukrainian official said on Tuesday. Ukrainian regional governor Sergei Gaidai stated that about 70% of the city is now under Russian control, adding that civilians are trapped. Russia has asked Ukrainian fighters in Sievierodonetsk to surrender by Wednesday.

257.title: Maharashtra govt makes rural stint mandatory for MBBS students
257.article_body: The Maharashtra government has announced that, starting academic year 2022-2023, Bachelor of Medicine and Bachelor of Surgery (MBBS) graduates will have to compulsorily complete their one-year rural stint after completing their course. An official circular further states that without completing the rural stint, students will not be considered eligible to apply for postgraduate entrance tests.

258.title: Aamir celebrates mom's b'day with ex-wife Kiran Rao, son Azad; video surfaces
258.article_body: Aamir Khan celebrated his mom Zeenat Hussain's birthday with his ex-wife Kiran Rao, son Azad Rao Khan and his relatives. In the video that surfaced online, Aamir was seen sitting with his mother, son Azad and Kiran. Azad can be seen helping his grandmother blow the candles placed on the cake and can be seen singing happy birthday.

259.title: OTT braver, more mature than films on love, relationships: Chitrangda
259.article_body: Actress Chitrangda Singh stated that OTT content is braver and more mature and experimental in portraying love and relationships. She added that there is an allowance for realism on the web which the audience expects. The actress further said that filmmakers think, "Is it this or that formula," adding that they are still gauging what the change is about.

260.title: Bulletproof cars, 50 police personnel part of plan to take Lawrence Bishnoi to Punjab
260.article_body: Punjab Police have submitted in a Delhi court that there will be about 50 police personnel and two bulletproof vehicles to take gangster Lawrence Bishnoi to the state. The police also said that 12 vehicles will run on the way to clear the route, adding, "All routes will be videographed." The court allowed Punjab Police to formally arrest the gangster.

261.title: Fame as a beast can overpower you, it can take everything away: Abhay
261.article_body: Speaking about keeping his life private, actor Abhay Deol said, "Fame as a beast can overpower you, and take away everything and suddenly you don’t have a personal life anymore." "Whereas I made a conscious effort, letting people believe what they want to believe. As long as I have my privacy, they can say whatever they want," he added.

262.title: People should understand Sonia, Rahul's chronology of corruption: BJP
262.article_body: BJP National Spokesperson Sambit Patra has said people should try to understand Congress leaders Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi's "chronology of corruption". "I want to know how this mother-son duo looted people's wealth," he added. Patra's comments come as Rahul Gandhi, who was probed by Enforcement Directorate in the National Herald case yesterday, was summoned again today.

263.title: Will Smith devastated over slapping Chris Rock at Oscars: Tyler Perry
263.article_body: Actor Tyler Perry has revealed that Will Smith was "devastated" after slapping comedian Chris Rock at the 2022 Oscars. He further said that it was extremely painful for Will, adding that Chris is a "pure champion" for handling the painful situation incredibly well. "[Will] couldn't believe what happened. He couldn't believe he did it," Tyler added.

264.title: Inclusivity of physically-challenged increasing in India: Para shooter Avani
264.article_body: Shooter Avani Lekhara, who became the first Indian woman to win two gold medals at Paralympics in Tokyo, said the inclusivity of physically-challenged people is increasing day-by-day in India. "We are on a very good path and we'll see a more inclusive India in future," she added. Notably, the 20-year-old has booked her quota at 2024 Paris Paralympics.

265.title: 7 crypto billionaires' combined wealth falls to $31 bn from $145 bn in 7 months
265.article_body: The combined net worth of seven crypto billionaires has plunged from a peak of $145 billion in November 2021 to $31 billion, as per Bloomberg Billionaires Index. Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao witnessed the biggest decline, with his net worth plunging from a high of $95.8 billion to $10.2 billion. Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong's wealth fell $11.6 billion during this period.

266.title: Video shows Lawrence Bishnoi after arrest by Punjab Police in Moosewala murder case
266.article_body: A video shows gangster Lawrence Bishnoi after he was arrested by Punjab Police. He was produced in Delhi's Patiala House Court on Tuesday. The court allowed Punjab Police to formally arrest the gangster, who is an accused in Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala's murder case. The gangster was earlier lodged in Tihar jail in Delhi.

267.title: Cong leader criticises Delhi Police's food for detained workers, shares video
267.article_body: Congress leader Manickam Tagore on Tuesday criticised food provided by the Delhi Police to party leaders detained for protesting against ED summons to Rahul Gandhi. A video shared by him showed 'poori' and 'sabji' kept in two containers. He later shared another video of food provided by Delhi Congress chief Anil Chaudhary.

268.title: It's an investigative drama, I play a crime beat journalist: Yami on 'Lost'
268.article_body: Speaking about her upcoming film 'Lost', Yami Gautam said it's an investigative drama. "Tony da’s (Aniruddha) world you can imagine in a film like this, with a...realistic tone, a lot of human drama," she said. "I play a crime beat journalist in it and in its own subtle way it touches about media integrity in today’s time," she added.

269.title: Love is blind, stronger than love of parents & society: K'taka HC
269.article_body: The Karnataka High Court, while allowing a girl who eloped and married her lover to stay with him, said that the case depicted that love is blind, stronger than the love of parents and family members. "What they are doing to their parents today, they will get back exactly tomorrow," the court added.

270.title: PM Modi launches special stamp to mark 200th anniversary of Mumbai Samachar
270.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday released a special postal stamp commemorating the 200 years of the Mumbai Samachar newspaper. While addressing a gathering, PM Modi said, "Under the influence of foreigners, when this city became Bombay, even then this newspaper didn't leave its local connect." He added that regional newspapers played an important role in the Independence struggle.

271.title: J&K DGP reviews security arrangements ahead of Amarnath Yatra
271.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir (J&K) Director General of Police (DGP) Dilbag Singh on Tuesday chaired a high-level meeting of senior officers from Police, Civil administration and CAPFs ahead of the upcoming Amarnath Yatra. He reviewed the security arrangements and deployment of personnel for the yatra. Notably, the Amarnath Yatra will begin on June 30 and conclude after 43 days.

272.title: Pak to suffer like Sri Lanka if fuel subsidies not lifted: Minister
272.article_body: Pakistan Finance Minister Miftah Ismail said that the country's economy will default and suffer consequences like crisis-hit Sri Lanka if the government doesn't lift fuel subsidies. Ismail stated that the government was still providing a subsidy of PKR 19 on petrol and PKR 53 on diesel. The IMF won't sign deal with Pakistan if fuel prices aren't increased, he added.

273.title: WhatsApp allows users to transfer chat history from Android to iPhone
273.article_body: WhatsApp will now allow users to transfer their chat history, photos, videos, and voice messages from Android to iPhone, Mark Zuckerberg announced on Tuesday. "This is a top requested feature," the CEO of WhatsApp parent Meta Platforms said. Android users will be able to transfer their WhatsApp data to iPhone using Apple's 'Move to iOS' app, while maintaining end-to-end encryption.

274.title: Shirtless man climbs atop moving police car, breaks windshield in Hyd; video viral
274.article_body: A shirtless man, who was reportedly drunk, climbed atop a moving police vehicle in Hyderabad, a video of which is being widely shared online. He damaged the rear windshield of the patrol car, police said. A policeman reportedly thrashed the man with a plastic baton once he got down from the vehicle.

275.title: Red alert in Assam, Meghalaya for heavy rainfall over next 2 days: IMD
275.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) on Tuesday issued a red alert for heavy rainfall over most places in Assam and Meghalaya from June 15-16. An orange alert has been issued for the two states from Jun 17-18. IMD has also issued an orange alert for Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram and Tripura till June 18 and for Arunachal Pradesh till June 17.

276.title: IPL becomes 2nd most valued sporting league as media rights sold for ₹48,390 crore
276.article_body: IPL overtook English Premier League to become the second-most valued sporting league in terms of per match value after its media rights were sold for ₹48,390 crore. IPL's TV rights (Package A) were bagged by Star India for ₹23,575 crore, amounting to ₹57.5 crore/match. Meanwhile, Viacom18 bagged digital rights (Package B and C) for ₹23,758 crore, amounting to ₹57.9 crore/match.

277.title: Kriti, Kartik, Farah remember Sushant on his 2nd death anniversary
277.article_body: Bollywood celebrities like Kriti Sanon, Kartik Aaryan and Farah Khan took to social media to remember late actor Sushant Singh Rajput on his second death anniversary. Kriti shared a heart emoji with the song 'Darasal' from their 2017 film 'Raabta'. Kartik shared a picture of Sushant, writing in the caption, "Stars always shine no matter where they are."

278.title: Prime goal is to win two World Cups in next 18 months: Babar Azam
278.article_body: Pakistan captain Babar Azam said he'll consider his runs "worth gold" if he's able to achieve the prime goal of winning the two World Cups (T20 and ODI) for the side in next 18 months. Pakistan won T20 World Cup in 2009 under Younis Khan, while they won ODI World Cup in 1992 under their former Prime Minister Imran Khan.

279.title: Kyrgios only other player than Djokovic who can beat everyone on grass: Todd
279.article_body: Ex-Australia tennis player Todd Woodbridge has said if there is any player besides Novak Djokovic who can play well enough and beat everyone on grass, it's compatriot Nick Kyrgios. "He is a legitimate force and has a chance to go deep at Wimbledon," he added. Kyrgios best result at Wimbledon came in 2014, when he reached the quarter-finals.

280.title: My mom cried when she saw 48% in my prelim SSC result: Shilpa
280.article_body: Actress Shilpa Shetty has revealed that her mother producer Sunanda Shetty cried when she saw her SSC prelims report in which she had scored 48%. "My mom...bawled for the first time. She said you're going to be absolutely useless, worthless and nikammi," Shilpa added. The actress said that she then studied well for 10 days and scored a decent percentage.

281.title: He's busy with other issues: Thakur on Rahul's 'maha jumla' remark
281.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur criticised Congress leader Rahul Gandhi for calling Centre's announcement of recruitment of 10 lakh people in 18 months as "maha jumla". "Rather than welcoming the decision, he is too busy dealing with other issues to show his happiness towards this," Thakur said. "This is a government of not 'jumlas', but 'maha jumlas'," Rahul Gandhi tweeted earlier.

282.title: 3 brothers threaten to blow up district court in UP, arrested
282.article_body: Three brothers were arrested for threatening to blow up the UP district court premises and an armed police force deployed there, police said on Tuesday. SP Chakresh Mishra said that the three brothers, who were working as labourers, were in an inebriated state when they made the threat call. The trio regularly made such calls after consuming alcohol, he said.

283.title: Mumbai logs 1,724 new COVID-19 cases, 2 deaths; positivity rate rises to 15.58%
283.article_body: Mumbai has reported 1,724 fresh COVID-19 cases, 1,240 recoveries and two deaths in the last 24 hours. The city's positivity rate on Tuesday has increased to 15.58%, compared to Monday's 11.6%. The number of active cases in Mumbai stands at 11,813. The overall growth rate of COVID-19 cases in the city between June 7 and 13 was 0.149%.

284.title: Mumbai woman kills self, husband booked for abetment to suicide
284.article_body: The Bhandup police registered a case of abetment to suicide against a 28-year-old man for allegedly assaulting and harassing his 24-year-old wife, who died by suicide. The two got married in August 2020 without informing anyone, the police said. After a few months, there were regular arguments between them, during which the 28-year-old would manhandle the woman, police added.

285.title: PWD engineer arrested for accepting ₹40,000 bribe in MP's Bhopal
285.article_body: The Lokayukta Police arrested an executive engineer of Madhya Pradesh's Public Works Department (PWD) for accepting a bribe of ₹40,000 in Bhopal, an official said. A Rajgarh-based contractor had complained that the accused demanded ₹1 lakh "commission" for releasing security deposit kept against a contract work, police said. A case was registered under Prevention of Corruption Act, police added.

286.title: Drugs worth ₹8 lakh seized in Gujarat's Vadodara, 4 arrested
286.article_body: Police arrested four people in Gujarat's Vadodara and seized 81.04 gram of mephedrone drug worth ₹8 lakh, which they had allegedly procured from Madhya Pradesh, officials said. Vadodara Police's Special Operations Group (SOG) said the four accused, including a woman from Maharashtra, are part of the "Bichchhu Gang". With this, the police claimed to have busted an inter-state drug racket.

287.title: Flood control cell set up in Faridabad to monitor waterlogging
287.article_body: Ahead of the monsoon season, a flood control cell has been set up to deal with waterlogging in Faridabad, the city's Deputy Commissioner Jitender Yadav said. He also directed officials to ensure that all the cleaning works are completed before the monsoon season. Yadav said that over 100 civil defence volunteers will be roped in to assist the police.

288.title: 2 Mumbai men get 20 years in prison for minor's gangrape in 2017
288.article_body: A Special Mumbai court sentenced two men, Kiran Gaikwad and Ajay Waghmare, to 20 years of imprisonment for gangraping a minor in 2017. One of them had sexually assaulted the girl, while the other filmed the act. The court sentenced third accused Salim Ansari to three years in jail for harassing the girl by threatening to release the video.

289.title: South Africa to bowl first against India in third T20I, both sides unchanged
289.article_body: South Africa captain Temba Bavuma won the toss and elected to bowl first against India in third T20I in Visakhapatnam. Both the playing XIs are unchanged. India stand-in captain Rishabh Pant mentioned that he would also have bowled first had he won the toss. South Africa lead the five-match series 2-0 after having won the T20Is in Delhi and Cuttack.

290.title: No DJs during Kanwar Yatra in Rajasthan: State Chief Secretary
290.article_body: The Rajasthan government has disallowed the use of DJs during the Kanwar Yatra held in the state. According to the state government, vehicles with DJs mounted on them will be confiscated by police. State Chief Secretary Usha Sharma, while announcing the decision, asked police officers to emphasise coordination with people to avoid communal incidents.

291.title: President Kovind attends 'Lokarpana' of ISKCON temple in B'luru
291.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind on Tuesday attended the 'Lokarpana' of ISKCON Sri Rajadhiraja Govinda Temple in Bengaluru on Tuesday. According to ISKCON (International Society for Krishna Consciousness), Sri Rajadhiraja Govinda Temple on Kanakapura Road is a traditional, stone-carved structure and a replica of the famous Sri Venkateswara temple in Andhra Pradesh.

292.title: Not letting Ajit Pawar speak at PM's event is Maha's insult: Sule
292.article_body: Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) leader Supriya Sule on Tuesday said that not letting Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar speak at inauguration of Pune's Sant Tukaram Shila temple is an insult to the state. "A request was made to the PMO to allow [Pawar] to speak, but [there was no response]," Sule added. PM Narendra Modi attended the ceremony earlier today.

293.title: Thieves steal gold, diamond jewellery worth ₹4 cr in Mumbai, arrested
293.article_body: Police on Tuesday said three persons have been arrested for allegedly stealing gold and diamond jewellery worth ₹4 crore from a rented premises in south Mumbai. Deepak Jain, the complainant, claimed that his father "appeared in his dream", asking him to visit the room and collect the "treasure". Jain did not find the jewellery when he reached the room.

294.title: Cabinet approves development of Greenfield Airport in Guj's Dholera
294.article_body: Cabinet Committee on Economic Affairs has approved the development of Phase I of Greenfield Airport in Gujarat's Dholera. Union Minister Anurag Thakur said that 1,501 hectares of land have been allocated for the airport which'll be built within 48 months. It's expected to handle 2,73,000 tonne cargo and cater to 23 lakh passengers in the next 20 years, he added.

295.title: Still unclear what problem audience had: Chandraprakash on 'Samrat...' failure
295.article_body: Speaking about Samrat Prithviraj's poor performance at the box office, filmmaker Chandrapraksh Dwivedi said that he failed to understand what problem the audience had. "YRF presented this story at a huge scale. But people had a problem. It’s still unclear to me what problem they had," he said. "The writers did an honest job of following...historical facts," Chandraprakash added.

296.title: Pakistan creating communal tension to disturb peace in J&K: BJP
296.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir BJP chief Ravinder Raina on Tuesday said that Pakistan hatched a conspiracy in the form of targeted killings and dividing people on religious lines to disturb peace in the union territory. "The people of Jammu and Kashmir are desirous of peace as they have seen enough of Pakistan-sponsored terrorism," he said.

297.title: Star India wins IPL TV rights for ₹23,575 cr, Viacom18 bags digital rights for ₹23,758 cr
297.article_body: Star India has acquired IPL's TV rights for the next five years (2023-2027 cycle) for a record ₹23,575 crore, while Reliance-led Viacom18 bagged the digital rights for ₹23,758 crore. Notably, Sony held the media rights for the first 10 years of IPL for about ₹8,200 crore, while Star India held the rights for 2018 to 2022 cycle for ₹16,347 crore.

298.title: Tiwary told 'If you impress Kohli, you'll play IPL': RCB's Akash Deep
298.article_body: RCB pacer Akash Deep has revealed how he was selected to play in IPL. "Manoj Tiwary bhaiya said, 'Virat Kohli is India's captain and if you manage to impress him, you will get to play in the IPL next season and might play for India as well,'" said Akash Deep. The 25-year-old played five matches for RCB in IPL 2022.

299.title: 25-yr-old Delhi man kills his wife for refusing to cook for him
299.article_body: A 25-year-old man allegedly stabbed his 28-year-old wife to death because she refused to cook for him after an argument, in Delhi's Neb Sarai locality on Monday. Deputy Commissioner of Police (south) Benita Mary Jaiker said the suspect, Dharmender, works as a cleaner at a restaurant. The suspect is absconding and efforts are being made to arrest him, she added.

300.title: Pune's Ruby Hall Clinic allowed to resume live organ transplants
300.article_body: The Maharashtra health department has passed an order allowing the Ruby Hall Clinic in Pune to resume live organ transplants, months after the hospital's organ transplant registration was suspended. The hospital will have to set up a fresh committee to monitor organ transplants, as per an official order. A kidney swap transplant case was reported at the hospital recently.

301.title: Nutraj Bactopure announces India's 1st pathogen-free* dry fruit & nuts
301.article_body: Dry fruits and nuts may contain harmful bacteria, causing diseases like cholera and typhoid, said Nutraj, revealing that its Nutraj Bactopure- dry fruits & nuts range uses German technology to kill harmful bacteria from the product. It provides "certificate of purity" from government-approved laboratory which can be verified by scanning the QR Code provided on each pack, the brand added.

302.title: Deepika rushed to hospital after increased heart rate, returns to sets: Report
302.article_body: Deepika Padukone, who's in Hyderabad shooting for her film 'Project K', was rushed to a private hospital as she felt unwell after her heart rate increased, as per reports. She was immediately taken to Kamineni Hospital in the city where the doctors examined her, reports added. Soon after treatment, Deepika reportedly returned to the sets as her heart rate stabilised.

303.title: Bengal Assembly passes bill to remove Guv as Visitor of pvt universities
303.article_body: The West Bengal Assembly on Tuesday passed a bill to replace Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar with the state Education Minister Bratya Basu as the Visitor of private universities. This comes after the Assembly passed a bill seeking to replace Dhankhar with CM Mamata Banerjee as the state-run universities' Chancellor. Both the bills need to get consent from Dhankhar before becoming acts.

304.title: Google announces startup accelerator programme for women in India
304.article_body: Google has announced the launch of 'Google for Startups Accelerator India: Women Founders', an accelerator programme specially for women entrepreneurs in India. The programme's inaugural batch will accept up to 20 women-founded/co-founded startups in India and support them through a three-month programme. Its curriculum will include workshops and support around product strategy and growth.

305.title: Pune Police book 36 people for gambling, seize ₹6.80 lakh cash
305.article_body: Pune Police on Saturday raided a gambling den in the city's Mangalwar Peth area and booked 36 persons under relevant sections of the anti-gambling act. An estimated ₹6.80 lakh cash was also seized from the accused, who were nabbed from the parking lot of a residential building in the area. The main accused, identified as Bhimashankar, has been arrested.

306.title: Oil crosses $123 mark as tight supply counters recession worries
306.article_body: Oil price crossed the $123 mark on Tuesday as tight global supply overpowered worries that fuel demand would be hit by a possible recession and fresh COVID-19 curbs in China. While Brent crude rose 94 cents to $123.21/barrel, US West Texas Intermediate (WTI) rose 79 cents to $121.72/barrel. Tight supply has been aggravated by a drop in exports from Libya.

307.title: PM Modi arrives in Mumbai, attends event with Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray
307.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday inaugurated the Jal Bhushan Building and Gallery of Revolutionaries at the Raj Bhavan in Mumbai. Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray was also present at the programme. PM Modi was received by Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari, Thackeray, Deputy CM Ajit Pawar and Protocol Minister Aaditya Thackeray at the INS Shikra heliport.

308.title: Coinbase fires 1,100 employees, CEO says 'we appear to be entering recession'
308.article_body: Coinbase is laying off 18% of its workforce, or about 1,100 employees citing "economic downturn", amid a collapse in its stock and crypto prices. The crypto exchange's CEO Brian Armstrong told employees, "We appear to be entering a recession after a 10+ year economic boom." Earlier this month, Coinbase extended its hiring freeze and rescinded a number of accepted offers.

309.title: College of Engineering Pune tops AICTE's learning assessment survey
309.article_body: College of Engineering Pune has been ranked first in All India Council for Technical Education's (AICTE) learning assessment survey, with 314 undergraduates scoring over 70% in the test. Jharkhand's Birsa Institute of Technology and Karnataka's NMAM Institute of Technology ranked second and third. The three colleges don't fall in National Institute Ranking Framework's list of top 50 colleges.

310.title: Mamata meets Sharad Pawar ahead of Oppn's meet on Presidential poll
310.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Tuesday met NCP chief Sharad Pawar at his residence in Delhi ahead of the Opposition's meeting to discuss the Presidential election to be held next month. Banerjee last week wrote to leaders of 22 opposition parties for the meeting. The Opposition's meeting is scheduled for June 15 (Wednesday).

311.title: Kevin Spacey to face London court over 4 counts of sexual assault
311.article_body: Actor Kevin Spacey has been formally charged with four counts of sexual assault against three men and is expected to appear in a London court on Thursday. UK's Crown Prosecution Service (CPS) has authorised the charges against the actor. One of the charges is from March 2005, two others are dated August 2008 and the fourth is from April 2013.

312.title: Ring up Dhoni or talk to Rahul: Hogg to Pant after India's 2 losses vs SA
312.article_body: Following Rishabh Pant-led India's two losses in first two T20Is against South Africa in ongoing five-match series, Brad Hogg said the India captain needs to be more decisive and take control in the middle. "If he needs to learn anything, he can ring up MS Dhoni or talk to KL Rahul," he added. Third T20I will be played on Tuesday.

313.title: Police arrest 2 aides of Lawrence Bishnoi, Goldy Brar in Mohali
313.article_body: The Mohali Police and Anti-Gangster Task Force on Tuesday arrested two active members of the Lawrence Bishnoi gang and Canada-based gangster Goldy Brar, officials said. SSP Vivek Sheel Soni said that the accused had been in touch with Goldy Brar through another gangster Manpreet Singh, who provided a car to the assailants involved in the Sidhu Moosewala murder case.

314.title: I'll repay all my loans & eat to my heart's content: Kamal Haasan on Vikram's success
314.article_body: Kamal Haasan, speaking about the success of his film 'Vikram', said, "When I said 'I can earn ₹300 crore in a snap', nobody understood...They thought I was beating my chest. You can see now it's coming." "I'll repay all my loans, I'll eat to my heart's content and I'll give whatever I can to my family and friends," he added.

315.title: Delhi reports 1,118 fresh cases of COVID-19, 82% more than yesterday
315.article_body: Delhi on Tuesday reported 1,118 fresh COVID-19 cases, which is 82% more than Monday's 614 cases. The national capital also reported two coronavirus-related deaths on Tuesday, while 500 people recovered from the infection. The city has recorded a case positivity rate of 6.5%. As many as 1,910 patients are under home isolation and 149 are undergoing treatment at hospitals.

316.title: NordVPN to remove servers in India amid govt order to store user data
316.article_body: NordVPN said it is "no longer able to keep servers in India" after the government's CERT-In introduced new rules requiring VPN service providers to collect and store user data for at least five years. NordVPN will remove its servers on June 26, a day before the new rules come into force. Earlier, Surfshark and ExpressVPN announced shutting down India servers.

317.title: They banned my name: Lalit Modi to man saying BCCI should thank him over IPL media rights
317.article_body: With IPL media rights reportedly fetching over ₹44,000 crore in e-auction, a man on Twitter said BCCI should thank ex-IPL Chairman Lalit Modi. Lalit replied, "They even banned my name...This is the fear they have as they did nothing to establish it...Reap the money. It doesn't bother me...But they can’t take away the fact I created it...That’s enough for me."

318.title: Punjab Police allowed to formally arrest Lawrence Bishnoi in Moosewala murder case
318.article_body: A Delhi court on Tuesday allowed Punjab Police to formally arrest gangster Lawrence Bishnoi, an accused in Sidhu Moosewala murder case. Lawrence Bishnoi's lawyer had opposed Punjab Police's plea, stating that they have apprehension that Lawrence Bishnoi may be killed in a fake encounter in Punjab. The gangster was earlier lodged in Tihar jail in Delhi.

319.title: 2 Telangana BJP leaders arrested in Hyd over skit against CM KCR
319.article_body: Telangana BJP leaders Rani Rudrama and Daruvu Yellanna have been arrested in Hyderabad for allegedly enacting a skit defaming CM K Chandrashekar Rao. A notice has been served to state BJP chief Bandi Sanjay to appear before police for questioning in this connection. The skit was enacted on Telangana Formation Day on June 2.

320.title: Construction of cable-stayed bridge in Rajasthan complete, pic released
320.article_body: Union Road Transport and Highways Minister Nitin Gadkari has announced that the project for the construction and maintenance of a cable-stayed bridge across river Chambal on Rajasthan's Kota Bypass has been completed. Gadkari added that the 1.4-km-long bridge, built with a capital expenditure worth ₹214 crore, is capable of tackling extreme traffic situations and handling heavy rainfall and winds.

321.title: 70 Afghan couples marry at mass wedding ceremony in Kabul
321.article_body: As many as 70 Afghan couples got married in Kabul at a mass wedding ceremony on Monday in presence of Taliban fighters, reports have stated. A local NGO reportedly organised the ceremony as the couples were unable to make their respective arrangements due to financial constraints. "I have no job. We were short of money," a 22-year-old bridegroom told reporters.

322.title: Things were worse for women earlier: H'wood actress Constance Marie
322.article_body: Hollywood actress Constance Marie has stated in an interview that things were worse for women in the industry "back in the day". She added that women were not offered lead parts of any projects and were always the thing that needed to be rescued. "Like we couldn't even [do anything]...You are always [standing there]," the actress added.

323.title: Was laughing for show, traumatic time: Archana on news of mom-in-law's death
323.article_body: Archana Puran Singh recalled a "traumatic" event which occurred during her stint on 'Comedy Circus'. She revealed that she came to know about her mother-in-law's death in the middle of an episode. "The production house asked me to give...reactions and go. Reactions were laughter...I still can't forget I was sitting there laughing...All I could think of was...my mother-in-law," she added.

324.title: 5-time winner Murray withdraws from Queen's Club Championships due to injury
324.article_body: Five-time champion Andy Murray has been forced to withdraw from the Queen's Club Championships in London due to an abdominal injury, the tournament's organisers said on Monday. The ex-world number one suffered the injury during Sunday's Boss Open final loss to Italian Matteo Berrettini in Stuttgart. Murray last won a title on grass at Wimbledon in 2016.

325.title: People said Pak couldn't chase 350, we did it against Australia: Azam
325.article_body: Talking about his team, Pakistan captain Babar Azam said, "People said we couldn't chase 350. We did [that against Australia in April 2022]." "We talked about how we needed to play different cricket," added Azam. Azam stated his team still needs to improve in certain areas, highlighting losing wickets in clusters and the need for better concentration from his players.

326.title: Mumbai to witness 6 of upcoming monsoon's 22 high tides this week
326.article_body: Of the 22 high tides predicted to hit Mumbai this monsoon, six will occur this week alone, according to the Disaster Management Cell. The six tides will be around 4.5 metres high and if Mumbai witnesses high rainfall on the day of the tides, there could be episodes of heavy inundation. BMC has already deployed personnel on Mumbai's six beaches.

327.title: Anand Mahindra, retired IIM professor Dholakia & 2 others to join RBI board
327.article_body: The central government has appointed Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra and three others as non-official Directors on the Central Board of Reserve Bank of India. Apart from Mahindra, others are Dr Ravindra H Dholakia, an IIM Ahmedabad retired professor, Venu Srinivasan, Chairman Emeritus TVS Motor Company and Pankaj R Patel, Chairman at Zydus Lifesciences Limited.

328.title: Best time I've ever had at the movies: Captain America writer praises 'RRR'
328.article_body: Jackson Lanzing, who has worked on comic book titles like Batman Beyond and Captain America, took to Twitter to praise Ram Charan and Jr NTR-starrer 'RRR'. He wrote, "Hey Jackson, was RRR the best time you've ever had at...movies?" followed by a GIF of Charan giving a thumbs up. Earlier, 'Doctor Strange' writer C Robert Cargill also praised the film.

329.title: I was just numb, gobsmacked: Rio Ferdinand on Manchester United exit
329.article_body: Former Manchester United defender Rio Ferdinand said he was just "numb" and "gobsmacked" on being informed about Manchester United's decision to not renew his contract, resulting in Ferdinand's exit from the club in 2014. "[It would be] mind-boggling if they let [Ryan Giggs, Patrice Evra, Nemanja Vidic and me]...go, I couldn't see it...and then we all went!" added Ferdinand.

330.title: Cong acting like Sonia, Rahul Gandhi never do any wrong: K'taka Minister
330.article_body: Karnataka Minister R Ashoka on Tuesday said Congress is acting like party leaders Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi "can never do any wrong and whatever they do is right". Congress is trying to subvert the Indian Constitution by shielding Sonia and Rahul in the National Herald case, the BJP leader said. Congress is carrying out "protest drama", Ashoka added.

331.title: Administrator at Srei finds over ₹3,000 cr in fraudulent transactions
331.article_body: The RBI-appointed administrator at Srei Equipment Finance Ltd has found fraudulent transactions worth over ₹3,000 crore conducted over FY20 and FY21. Loans involved with these transactions were at ₹2,512 crore, while the notional loss to the company stood at ₹513.67 crore, the company's filing said. The administrator has filed an application with the National Company Law Tribunal in this regard.

332.title: Video shows K'taka CM crying after watching 777 Charlie; says 'reminded me of my late dog'
332.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj S Bommai broke down into tears after watching the film '777 Charlie' and said that it reminded him of his pet dog Snooby that passed away last year. "I keep talking about unconditional love. A dog's love is unconditional love, which is pure," CM Bommai told reporters.

333.title: Seeing my parents jump with joy meant the world to me: Manushi on debut film
333.article_body: Speaking about her parents' reaction after watching her film 'Samrat Prithviraj', former Miss World Manushi Chhillar said, "My parents have always been...supportive of my decisions and I wanted them to enjoy watching me on screen." "To see them jump with joy...and listen to how they felt I was good in my debut film, meant the world to me," she added.

334.title: I only agreed to do 'Sam Bahadur' because of Meghna Gulzar: Fatima
334.article_body: Actress Fatima Sana Shaikh, who will be portraying former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi in Vicky Kaushal-starrer 'Sam Bahadur', revealed that she only agreed to do the movie because of filmmaker Meghna Gulzar. The actress further said that she gave only one look-test for the film. Fatima had said in an earlier interview that working with Meghna is a personal milestone.

335.title: Newlyweds Nayanthara, Vignesh visit temple in Kerala, pics surface
335.article_body: Newlywed couple Nayanthara and director Vignesh Shivan visited Kerala's Chettikulangara Devi temple, where they performed a puja. In the pictures that have surfaced online, Nayanthara could be seen in a floral ethnic suit and Vignesh in a traditional mundu. The couple earlier visited Tirupati temple. Nayanthara and Vignesh got married on June 9 in Mahabalipuram.

336.title: Have discussed about taking stance on human rights issues in Qatar: Harry Kane
336.article_body: England's Harry Kane said that he has discussed with France's Hugo Lloris and Denmark's Christian Eriksen about taking a collective stance on human rights issues surrounding this year's football World Cup in Qatar. "When we come to a decision...for sure we will share it," Kane said. Recently, a report alleged that thousands of migrant workers in Qatar were being exploited.

337.title: Political witch-hunt: TMC as CBI questions Abhishek's wife in coal scam
337.article_body: TMC on Tuesday accused the Centre of engaging in a "political witch-hunt" after a CBI team questioned West Bengal MP Abhishek Banerjee's wife Rujira in connection with the coal scam. "Minutes after our National General Secretary...lands in Agartala, 'remote controlled' CBI springs into action," TMC tweeted. Notably, CBI had interrogated Rujira last year ahead of the state assembly elections.

338.title: Ex-U'khand AAP chief Deepak Bali joins BJP after quitting party
338.article_body: Former Uttarakhand Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) chief Deepak Bali on Tuesday joined the Bharatiya Janata Party a day after resigning from his post and membership of AAP. Bali joined the BJP in the presence of Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami. In a letter, Bali had cited being "uncomfortable with the party's methodology" as a reason for his resignation from AAP.

339.title: ₹2,366 cr power bills pending against govt departments: Punjab power body
339.article_body: According to Punjab State Electricity Board Engineers' Association, the state's government departments are the major defaulters of electricity bills. Reports said that power bills worth ₹2,366 crore are pending against them as of April 2022. Subsidy bills of ₹9,000 crore are also pending against the Punjab government as of date, the association reportedly added.

340.title: German howitzers soon to be ready for use in Ukraine: Defence Min
340.article_body: Germany's Defence Minister Christine Lambrecht said that Ukrainian troops receiving training on using German howitzers would soon complete their exercise and therefore be able to use the weapons in the war in Ukraine. The Panzerhaubitze 2000 is one of the most powerful artillery weapons in the German army's inventories. It can hit targets at a distance of 40 kilometres.

341.title: 4 JD(U) leaders suspended from party on disciplinary grounds
341.article_body: Four leaders of Janata Dal (United) were suspended from the primary membership of the party on Tuesday on disciplinary grounds. These include Anil Kumar, Bipin Kumar Yadav, Ajay Alok and Jitendra Neeraj. "They were running a parallel programme contrary to the party's ideology and were misguiding party workers despite holding important positions," said Bihar JD(U) chief Umesh Kushwaha.

342.title: Understand the chronology: Surjewala as wholesale inflation rises
342.article_body: As India’s WPI surged to a record high of 15.88% in May, Congress’ Randeep Singh Surjewala said that ED’s notice is served to people who raise their voices against inflation. "Understand the chronology-Issue a notice of ED to the voices raised against inflation so that the attention is diverted under the guise of ED's probe," Surjewala tweeted.

343.title: Google Maps launches new feature to estimate toll charges on a route
343.article_body: Google Maps has launched a new feature that will estimate the amount that a user has to pay in tolls on their selected route. The feature has been enabled on Android and iOS apps for users in the US, India, Japan, and Indonesia. Previously, the app would alert users about an upcoming toll but didn't calculate its amount.

344.title: Amarnath Yatra pilgrims told to undergo Aadhaar Authentication voluntarily
344.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir government has released a notification, asking pilgrims planning to undertake the Amarnath Yatra to furnish proof of possession of Aadhaar or undergo Aadhaar Authentication on a voluntary basis. According to officials, the decision has been taken as part of measures to tighten security, amid threats from terrorist groups across the border to disrupt the yatra.

345.title: Akshay told me if 'Samrat...' fails, he'll go back to 'Rowdy...': Maker
345.article_body: Dr Chandraprakash Dwivedi, the director of Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Samrat Prithviraj', said Akshay told him that he will go back to working in movies like 'Rowdy Rathore' and films from the 'Housefull' franchise if 'Samrat Prithviraj' fails. "[Those] films pay me more...People want to watch things which have no controversies.Then that's what I will do," added Dwivedi sharing what Akshay said.

346.title: After almost a year, Olympic champion Neeraj to return to action tonight
346.article_body: After staying away from the athletic field for almost a year, Olympic gold medallist Neeraj Chopra is set to return to action at the Paavo Nurmi Games in Finland tonight. "It's a pleasure to have you (Neeraj) in Turku," read the post on the games' official Instagram handle. The competition will also feature players like Anderson Peters and Jakub Vadlejch.

347.title: 2 Cong workers who protested against Kerala CM in flight arrested
347.article_body: Two Youth Congress workers, who had protested against Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan on board a flight on Monday, have been arrested on the charges of attempted murder, police said. A third Youth Congress worker who was also booked in the matter has reportedly gone into hiding. This comes as CPI(M) MP V Sivadasan wrote to DGCA Director-General over the matter.

348.title: Men worship peepal tree to not get same wives in next birth in Maharashtra
348.article_body: Members of 'patni peedit' ashram in Aurangabad held an agitation demanding laws against injustice they face. The men took 108 rounds around a peepal tree, praying not to get the same wives again. Ashram founder said they worshipped the peepal as women will worship banyan trees and pray for the same husbands for seven lives on 'Vat Purnima' on Tuesday.

349.title: How's a banned game available?: NCPCR after UP boy shoots mother dead over PUBG
