349.article_body: Child rights body NCPCR has written to the IT Ministry over reports that a 16-year-old boy in Uttar Pradesh shot his mother dead for stopping him from playing PUBG. "It's beyond understanding...how a banned game in India...is still available for use by minors," it said. The NCPCR has sought reasons from the government for availability of the blocked app.

350.title: Heavy rainfall warning issued for several states over next few days, list released
350.article_body: IMD issued heavy rainfall warning for several states and UTs. Heavy to very heavy rainfall is very likely over Arunachal Pradesh, West Bengal, Sikkim, Nagaland, Meghalaya and Manipur during next five days. Heavy rainfall is likely over Jharkhand and Bihar from June 16 to 18. Isolated heavy rainfall is likely over Madhya Pradesh and Chhattisgarh from June 15 to 17.

351.title: We have planned to continue attacking even if we lose wickets: Iyer
351.article_body: Indian batter Shreyas Iyer has said that the Indian team has planned to constantly go after the South African bowlers even if the former lose wickets. "Even if we keep losing wickets, it's our game plan and in the future too, we will go in with the same mindset. We will back ourselves and back our instincts," Iyer said.

352.title: New fake promise for polls?: Mayawati on PM's recruitment announcement
352.article_body: Reacting to PMO’s announcement that the Centre will recruit 10 lakh people in 1.5 years, BSP chief Mayawati asked, "Is this new fake promise for elections?" "Due to wrong policies and working style of the Centre, poverty...unemployment and devaluation of the rupee, each is at its peak," Mayawati tweeted. "Because of this, everyone is suffering and is restless," she added.

353.title: Climate crisis may lead to more violence towards women: Study
353.article_body: As per research published in the journal The Lancet Planetary Health, climate crisis has led to an increase in violence towards women, girls and sexual and gender minorities. Climate change-induced socioeconomic instability, structural power inequalities, breakdowns in safety and law enforcement etc could lead to an increase in gender-based violence across the world, scientists said.

354.title: Sri Lanka gives public workers extra day off to grow food
354.article_body: Sri Lanka's Cabinet has approved a four-day work week for public sector employees for the next three months to help them cope with a fuel shortage and encourage them to grow food in their backyards. Public servants will now have a holiday on Friday, Saturday and Sunday. The Friday leave won't apply to health, education, and other essential service sectors.

355.title: Air India's acquisition of AirAsia India approved by CCI
355.article_body: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) on Tuesday approved Tata Sons-owned Air India's proposal to acquire entire shareholding in AirAsia India. Prior to the acquisition, Tata Sons held a majority shareholding of 83.67% in AirAsia India, while the remaining stake was owned by AirAsia Investment Ltd (AAIL), part of Malaysia's AirAsia Group. Air India proposed to acquire AirAsia in April.

356.title: Karthik forced selectors to think 'Look, we can't ignore him': Kapil Dev
356.article_body: Former India captain Kapil Dev has praised wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik's recent performances, stating that the 37-year-old forced the selectors to not ignore him for selection in Team India. "Karthik has been playing cricket even before MS Dhoni. It's been 2 years since Dhoni retired but even now, Karthik has kept his motivation level high," Dev stated.

357.title: Water supply to be disrupted in some areas of Pune on June 16
357.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) on Tuesday said that the water supply in certain parts of the city will be disrupted on June 16 due to technical works. The affected areas include Anjali Nagar, Santosh Nagar, Sai Nagar, Datta Nagar, Telco Colony Campus, Sundhamata Nagar and Jambhulwadi Road Campus. Residents may receive low-pressure water supply the next day, PMC added.

358.title: UP man thrashes 3rd wife for objecting to his previous marriages
358.article_body: A man from UP married for the third time and allegedly beat his wife for objecting to his previous two marriages. The woman, in her complaint, said that the accused lied to her about being unmarried, adding that he started beating her when she objected to his previous marriages. The woman accused her in-laws of using casteist slurs.

359.title: Dangerous disconnect between science and govts over climate: UN
359.article_body: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres on Tuesday said there is a "historic and dangerous disconnect" between what science demands for climate action and what the governments are doing. "Many governments are dragging their feet. This inaction has grave consequences," he said at a climate conference in Austria. He added that the Russia-Ukraine conflict has worsened the crisis.

360.title: Sara shares pic on Sushant's death anniversary, says 'Many firsts happened because of you'
360.article_body: Sara Ali Khan shared an old picture with late actor Sushant Singh Rajput on his second death anniversary. "From facing...camera for...first time to seeing Jupiter and...Moon through your telescope- so many firsts...happened because of you," she wrote. "Today on Full Moon night when I look up...I know you'll be up there amongst your favourite stars and constellations," Sara added.

361.title: Salman is 'unconditional' with everything except SKF: Kichcha Sudeepa
361.article_body: Talking about Salman Khan, Kannada actor Kichcha Sudeepa said Salman is "unconditional" with everything except his production house 'Salman Khan Films'. "He will only collaborate if he likes it. He has seen the clippings [of my upcoming film 'Vikrant Rona'] and he loved it," added Sudeepa. "I am still spellbound by the visuals," Salman had tweeted about the movie.

362.title: Chiranjeevi praises Adivi's 'Major', says 'It's not a film, it's an emotion'
362.article_body: Chiranjeevi took to Twitter to praise Adivi Sesh's latest film 'Major', writing, "[It's]...not a film, it's truly an emotion." He also shared some pictures from his meeting with Adivi and the team of 'Major'. Reacting to Chiranjeevi's tweet, Adivi wrote, "Today feels like my highest honour sir! You spoke to us for hours...Fed us...amazing lunch...and explained what you loved about...film."

363.title: Taking daily classes for 'Minimum', I hope they pay off: Saba Azad
363.article_body: Actress Saba Azad has stated in an interview that she has been taking daily classes for her upcoming film 'Minimum', adding that she hopes the classes pay off. "The biggest perk of cinema [is] the new skills you get to learn along the way," the actress added. She will be essaying the role of a French girl in the film.

364.title: US Health Secy tests +ve for COVID, 2nd time in less than a month
364.article_body: US Health and Human Services (HHS) Secretary Xavier Becerra has tested positive for coronavirus for the second time in less than a month. Becerra is "fully vaccinated and boosted against COVID-19, and is experiencing mild symptoms", HHS spokesperson Sarah Lovenheim said on Monday. The 64-year-old had previously tested positive for the virus in mid-May during a trip to Berlin.

365.title: Congress considers its leaders above law: BJP's Sambit Patra
365.article_body: BJP leader Sambit Patra on Tuesday said that the Congress considers its leaders above the law. His remarks came after Congress workers protested in support of Rahul Gandhi who was summoned by the ED in the National Herald money laundering case. Patra said, "When lawful action is taking place in...case of corruption, Congress is doing this drama and blocking roads."

366.title: Haryana man arrested for gold robbery on Jaipur Superfast Express train
366.article_body: Police arrested a man from Haryana in robbery case that took place in first-class compartment of Jaipur Superfast Express last month and seized gold worth ₹12.50 lakh from him. They are looking for three of his accomplices. The accused and his aides reportedly stole gold worth ₹24 lakh from a 62-year-old man while he was preparing to deboard the train.

367.title: Saying no to golgappa guy for Dangal scene was tough, gave 5-10 takes: Sanya
367.article_body: While recalling a scene from her first movie 'Dangal', actress Sanya Malhotra said that saying no to the golgappa guy for the scene was very tough for her. She added that she gave five to ten takes for that scene, some of which were because of technical reasons. "It felt very personal to me...I was really scared," she added.

368.title: Haven't slept for a week, I'm so nervous: Alia on Brahmastra trailer release
368.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt shared a video on Instagram, where she asked her fans to watch the trailer of Brahmastra, which is releasing on Wednesday. In the video, she's heard saying, "I haven't slept for a week now. I'm so nervous that I saw the trailer 25-30 times." "People have been asking me...many questions about Brahmastra all these years," she added.

369.title: Ukraine crisis can aggravate drug problem in Europe: EU body
369.article_body: The Ukraine crisis owing to the Russian invasion could potentially expose more people to narcotics, European Monitoring Centre for Drugs and Drug Addiction (EMCDDA) has warned. In its annual report, the EMCDDA said that people who have suffered "severe psychological stress" during the conflict may be more vulnerable to problems related to substance abuse in the future.

370.title: Musk-owned SpaceX raises $1.68 billion through equity financing
370.article_body: Elon Musk-owned SpaceX has raised $1.68 billion through equity financing, it said in a regulatory filing on Monday. SpaceX had aimed to raise $1.725 billion, media reports said citing filing. Earlier, SpaceX Starship spacecraft and Super Heavy rocket program in Texas cleared US FAA's environmental assessment. The FAA has imposed over 75 conditions on the company.

371.title: 4 caged mongooses rescued from businessman's home in Thane
371.article_body: The Maharashtra Forest Department officials from Thane's Kalyan have rescued four caged mongooses from the residence of a businessman, who believed that keeping mongooses at his home would bring him wealth and prosperity. "Keeping mongooses at home is a legal offence under the Wildlife (Protection) Act," a forest officer said. Officials said legal action has been taken against the businessman.

372.title: Man held for carrying katta at Delhi's Escorts Mujesar Metro Station
372.article_body: A man was held by the Central Industrial Security Force on Monday for carrying a katta (country-made pistol) at Delhi's Escorts Mujesar Metro Station. A constable detected an image of a weapon inside the accused's bag and alerted the CISF supervisor, following which a gun with a live round was discovered, reports said.

373.title: 7,440 bottles of foreign liquor worth over ₹25 lakh seized in Gurugram
373.article_body: Gurugram Police seized a truck loaded with 7,440 bottles of Indian-made foreign liquor worth more than ₹25 lakh. The truck was transporting the bottles from a liquor godown in Sector 46 to another one in Sector 47, police said. The vehicle was found parked near a school in Sector 47 by a crime branch team.

374.title: Congress's Srinivas BV forced into bus by police during protest in Delhi
374.article_body: Youth Congress President Srinivas BV was detained while he was protesting the Enforcement Directorate (ED) probe against party leader Rahul Gandhi in Delhi. In a video, police are seen forcefully pushing Srinivas in a bus full of detained Congress workers. Srinivas can be seen resisting attempts to push him onto the police bus.

375.title: Britney, Sam signed prenup 'in her favour' before wedding: Report
375.article_body: Singer Britney Spears and husband Sam Asghari signed a prenuptial agreement "in her favour" ensuring the money she made before their wedding is protected, reported Page Six. The 40-year-old singer got engaged to the 28-year-old personal trainer-turned-actor in September. Sam had earlier joked, "We're getting iron-clad prenup to protect my jeep and shoe collection incase she dumps me one day."

376.title: Baseless: Ali Abbas Zafar on rumours of 'Bade Miyan...' shelving
376.article_body: Director Ali Abbas Zafar has refuted rumours of his film 'Bade Miyan Chote Miyan' shelving. "This is absolutely baseless. We're...on track...there's no truth to the shelving rumours," he stated. "We'll go on floors by the end of this year or early next year and shoot in the UK," Ali added. Akshay Kumar and Tiger Shroff will feature in the film.

377.title: 32-yr-old civic volunteer found dead with multiple injuries in WB's Malda
377.article_body: A 32-year-old man, who worked as a civic volunteer, was found dead in West Bengal's Malda district on Monday. According to officials, Bachchan Mondal's body was found with multiple sharp cuts in a jute field behind the Bedrabad Rural Hospital. Mondal, who was posted at the Baishnabnagar police station, had left home on Sunday night without informing anyone, officials added.

378.title: Britney Spears' ex-husband charged with stalking after trying to gatecrash her wedding
378.article_body: A US court charged singer Britney Spears' ex-husband Jason Allen Alexander with a felony count of stalking on Monday after he attempted to gatecrash her wedding with Sam Asghari in southern California. The judge issued a restraining order requiring Alexander to stay 100 yards from Spears. He was also charged with misdemeanour counts of trespassing, vandalism and battery.

379.title: HC tells CBI to probe 'illegal' primary school teacher appointments in Bengal
379.article_body: The Calcutta High Court has directed the CBI to look into the appointments of 269 primary school teachers in West Bengal government schools over allegations that they did not pass the eligibility test. State Primary Education Board President Manik Bhattacharya and Secretary Ratna Chakraborty have been asked to appear before the CBI on Tuesday.

380.title: Maha ATS arrests UP youth in terror funding case, brings him to Pune
380.article_body: Maharashtra Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) arrested a 20-year-old youth from Uttar Pradesh's Deoband in connection with the terror funding and recruitment of operatives for Lashkar-e-Taiba. He was brought to Pune on transit remand from Saharanpur jail where he was lodged after his arrest for alleged terror activities, ACP of Pune ATS, said. UP Police had arrested him for previous terror offences.

381.title: Mahima thanks people involved in her Cancer treatment; Tina Ambani reacts
381.article_body: Actress Mahima Chaudhry took to Instagram to thank everyone who was a part of her Cancer treatment. She also mentioned Tina Ambani in her video along with other staff members at the Kokilaben Dhirubhai Ambani Hospital. Tina reshared Mahima's video and wrote, "Thank you...Mahima for your wonderful message. It's so gracious...of you to name everyone involved in your recovery."

382.title: Appointment of new Chief of Defence Staff soon: Rajnath Singh
382.article_body: Days after the government publicly revised the standards for the selection procedure of CDS, Union Defence Minister Rajnath Singh has reportedly announced that the new Chief of Defence Staff will be appointed soon. According to an Economic Times report, the government is reviewing the records of around 30 active and retired officers for the CDS post.

383.title: Been answering if I regret quitting B'wood for 33 years: Bhagyashree
383.article_body: Bhagyashree, in an interview, said she has been answering if she regrets quitting Bollywood for the last 33 years. "My son, Abhimanyu...says everyone asks him the same question again," she stated. "No regrets because...I got the best of both worlds," she added. Bhagyashree quit Bollywood soon after making her debut with 'Maine Pyar Kiya' alongside actor Salman Khan.

384.title: Promise was to give 2 cr jobs a year: Surjewala on PM’s recruitment announcement
384.article_body: Soon after the PMO announced to recruit 10 lakh people in 1.5 years, Congress’ Randeep Singh Surjewala said the promise was to give two crore jobs every year. "Sixteen crore jobs were to be given in eight years. Now they're saying that by 2024, only 10 lakh jobs will be given," Surjewala tweeted. "Jumlebazi (mockery) for how long?" he added.

385.title: Man kills 6-month-old son after argument with wife in Punjab; held
385.article_body: A 29-year-old man was arrested on Monday for allegedly killing his six-month-old son at his residence following an argument with his wife in Punjab's Zirakpur. The wife claimed that the accused had suffocated her son to death with his hands. A case has been filed against the accused under Section 302 (murder) of Indian Penal Code, a police officer said.

386.title: Hyd gang-rape accused were served biryani by police: BJP leader
386.article_body: Telangana BJP chief Bandi Sanjay has alleged that police offered biryani to all the men accused of raping a 17-year-old girl in the Jubilee Hills area of Hyderabad. He added that the gang-rape was pre-planned. "Telangana has become a hub of killings and rapes," Sanjay said at a public meeting in Jawaharnagar.

387.title: I'll not be Opposition candidate for President's post: Sharad Pawar
387.article_body: Nationalist Congress Party chief Sharad Pawar has said that he's not in the race for the Presidential election scheduled to be held on July 18, a report said. He said, "I'm not in the race...I'll not be an Opposition candidate for the President's post." Pawar's remark came after the Congress in Maharashtra said it'd support him for the President's post.

388.title: 'Agnipath' military recruitment model is visionary move: Indian Navy
388.article_body: Indian Navy on Tuesday praised the newly-unveiled armed forces' recruitment model 'Agnipath', calling it a "visionary move that will bring multi-dimensional transformations to the Navy". The model, which will employ aspirants (below officer rank) for four years, will have a "positive impact", Chief of Naval Staff R Hari Kumar said. The aspirants will undergo training for six months after joining.

389.title: We're disappointed: Adani as SL official says PM Modi 'pressured' to award project
389.article_body: Adani Group has responded after a top Sri Lankan official claimed that PM Narendra Modi "pressured" Sri Lanka's President Gotabaya Rajapaksa to award a power project to the company. "We are clearly disappointed by the detraction that seems to have come about," the Gautam Adani-led company said. It added that the issue has already been addressed by Sri Lankan government.

390.title: India may lose 8,000 individuals with over $1 million net worth in 2022: Report
390.article_body: India has ranked third on the list of top 10 countries that are expected to witness an outflow of high-net-worth individuals (HNWIs), with more than $1 million wealth, in 2022, as per a report by Henley and Partners. India may lose 8,000 HNWIs this year, the report said. The list includes Russia, China, Hong Kong, Ukraine, Brazil, UK and Mexico.

391.title: Agnipath scheme will make Army future-ready fighting force: Army Chief
391.article_body: Indian Army Chief General Manoj Pande said that Agnipath scheme will make Army future-ready fighting force capable of meeting multiple challenges across full spectrum of conflict. "It'll increase technical threshold of Army by recruiting 'Agniveers' through ITIs and other...institutes," he added. The government launched Agnipath scheme on Tuesday that aims to recruit youngsters in armed forces.

392.title: AQI likely to stay 'good' in Mumbai for next couple of days: SAFAR
392.article_body: Mumbai's Air Quality Index is likely to remain in the 'good' category for the next two days, the forecast from the System of Air Quality and Weather Forecasting And Research read. It reported that Mumbai recorded an AQI of 28 on Monday, which was the best AQI of the year, while on Tuesday, the city's AQI was recorded at 37.

393.title: Fan shows his tribute tattoo to Federer at restaurant, Federer's reaction goes viral
393.article_body: A video of a fan showing his tribute tattoo to Roger Federer at a restaurant went viral. In the video, Federer can be seen rubbing the fan's arm to make sure the tattoo was real, before exclaiming, "Are you kidding me?" "There's no way around hard work. Embrace it. Federer, R," the tattoo read referring to a quote by Federer.

394.title: Umran is the second Indian player I’m excited to see after Sachin: Sunil Gavaskar
394.article_body: Former India captain Sunil Gavaskar has said that Umran Malik is the second Indian player he is excited to see after Sachin Tendulkar. "I do believe he should play, but again they might say that let us win the third T20I and get ourselves in a situation, and then maybe they can think about experimenting," he added.

395.title: Roger Federer now ranked 68th in the world, his worst ranking in 22 years
395.article_body: Ex-world number one Roger Federer is now ranked 68th in the world after having missed tournaments due to injury. It's the 20-time Grand Slam champion's worst ranking in over 22 years. Federer last featured in the Wimbledon in 2021. Meanwhile, Daniil Medvedev has reclaimed the number one spot. Alexander Zverev is world number two, while Djokovic is now ranked third.

396.title: World's 5 richest people including Musk collectively lost $345 bn in 2022
396.article_body: Among the world’s richest people, five billionaires collectively lost $345 billion this year, according to Bloomberg Billionaires Index. While Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao lost $85.6 billion in 2022 so far, he is followed by the world’s richest man Elon Musk, whose wealth declined by $73.2 billion. The world's 500 wealthiest people have collectively lost $1.4 trillion this year.

397.title: Amber Heard has a plan & strategy to make a comeback: Report
397.article_body: Actress Amber Heard has a "plan and strategy to make a comeback" after losing the defamation trial against Johnny Depp, reported ET. The report quoted a source saying Amber is planning to appeal the court's decision, adding that she feels very alone and like she lost a lot of friends. "She's confident...her side will come out eventually," the source added.

398.title: 'Vikram' director Lokesh gets mobbed by fans in Kerala, pics surface
398.article_body: 'Vikram' director Lokesh Kanagaraj and music composer Anirudh Ravichander were mobbed by fans at a theatre in Kerala's Thrissur. Vikram's Kerala distributor Shibu Thameens took to Twitter to share pictures from the theatre. The film, starring Kamal Haasan, Vijay Sethupathi, Fahadh Faasil and Suriya, has earned more than ₹300 crore globally.

399.title: BJP is giving collective punishment to Indian Muslims: Owaisi
399.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Tuesday said that BJP is giving collective punishment to Indian Muslims. "UP CM has become 'super Chief Justice'. He'll convict anybody in his own court," Owaisi added. "Afreen Fatima's house was in her mother's name...Why isn't BJP demolishing Teni's (son Ashish Mishra) home, accused of killing five people," he stated.

400.title: Cong to attend Opposition parties' meet called by Mamata Banerjee
400.article_body: Congress will take part in an Opposition leaders' meeting called by TMC chief and West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on June 15 in Delhi, ANI reported quoting sources. Congress leaders Mallikarjun Kharge, Jairam Ramesh and Randeep Singh Surjewala will reportedly take part in the meeting. The Opposition leaders' meeting has been scheduled ahead of the Presidential election on July 18.
